intermitted time power spared labour hauing beene present person eie witness execution great affaire haue necessarily beene inforced reduce digest writing neither wanted seeing occurrence high would take paine time endeuour themselues god would alwaies fight protesting able ouerrunne nation although themselues yea although moses would endeuour estraunge god word behoouefull lord themselues therefore said conforme selues opinion men seeke world wherein might liue soly according particular policy religion hebrewes blinded loue bare vnto virgin conceiued wel hebrewes blinded loue woman particular vnwilling draw desperatiō whilest thinke lye hidden may reduced better mind told thing vnworthie ill beseeming themselues elder set pleasure god religion behooued whilest time repent themselues shewed themselues valiant men contempt lawes appeasing disordinate desire besides told absurd thing whereas desart liued modestly plentifull countrey grow dissolute disordinate lose affluence got temperance like speech indeuoured correct youth reduce better mind whereupon zambrias rising vp spake manner moses saith vse thou thine owne lawes whereunto long vse thou hast added zambrias oration moses strength confirmation hadst thou done oft time ere hadst thou suffered punishment learnt thine owne miserie hebrewes deluded selfe thou shalt neuer tye thy tyrannical decree hitherto hast thou indeuoured nought else vnder pretext law religion bring v seruitude subiection thy selfe thy subtile sinister meanes honour soueraintie taking v pleasure libertie liues thing belong free men appertaine liue vnder man gouernment worse aegyptian thraldome punish euery man thy lawes according thine owne pleasure whereas thou thy selfe art worthie punished thou disanullest thing approued men consent desirest thy decree force resolution mortall men whatsoeuer touching doe suppose well done affraid confesse assemblie namely haue taken straunger wife thou hearest mine action mine owne mouth free resolute man neither doe desire hidden likewise sacrifice god contrarie custome suppose iust necessarie many seeke truth depending vpon tyranny liuing thereunder build faith vpon one man shal please haue interest mine action selfe whilest zambrias alledged himselfe faction people silently expected issue audacious boldnes especially saw lawmaker would contend longer least make conered wall feare least thereafter fall let receiueth thing trust keepe carefully thing sacred deut 24 diuine let neither man woman attempt alien committed custody although thereby might gaine infinite sum gold although man could conuince therof since generally conscience knoweth euery one ought indeuour himselfe deale vprightly supposing himselfe sufficient witnes himselfe let thing endureth reproued eunuch detested company fled depriue themselues manhood gift begetting child god hath giuen vnto men increase mankind people therefore driuen farre v esteemed wholie inexcusable kill child borne matter verie manifest spirit effeminate body also degenerate thing also monstrous behold driuen away neither lawfull geld either men beast let disposition lawes wherewith shall pollicied gouerned time peace god fauourable vnto giue grace vse good order without confusion since cannot otherwise humane affaire must somtimes fall trouble daungers somewhiles beyond desire expectation otherwhiles set purpose briefely set downe certaine lawes touching point intent fore instructed ought may haue aboundance holsome remedy well prouided instructed ought may preuent fall daunger calamitie god grant may inioy countrey hath giuen contempt trauels exercise vertues may possesse securitie peace stranger may leuie army ouerthrow ciuill mutinie may raised amongst may bring passe hath well ordered decreed auncestors doe come nought shall happen commit contrarie liue therefore persist conforme selues lawes god hath approued good hath also giuen perhaps selues present successours hereafter shall fortune entertaine vndertake warre god grant may happen without lawes warre deut 20 heraulds sent confines countrey matter must need tried sword shall send certaine heraulds destinated enemy enter battell shall requisite first parlee declare vnto haue great army horse weapon besides haue god fauour assistance shall require therefore may inforced warre make bootie good carrie away spight resist condescend vnto reasonable condition entertaine peace making accompt stronger need offer iniurie shall lead foorth army hauing god generall soueraigne conductor lieutenant selues haue chosen surpassing rest valour whereas diuers commander falleth ought necessarily readily executed hindered commonly issue vnfortunate diuers commander let army generally leuied men strong body hardie courage sequester armie fearefull least men hapning flie ought fight giue enemy aduantage let also free warre hauing built new house haue enioyed yeares space also hath planted vineyard hath gathered fruit thereof besides hath wedded wife hath yet brought home house least transported desire thing reseruing themselues forsaken pleasure behalfe wiues fight faintly coldly haue brought army field take heed commit outrage shall assault city fortune haue need matter make engins grub land neither see cut downe fruitfull tree spare remembring fruitfull tree cut downe planted good men could speake would accuse alledging without cause warre ill intreated right power depart thence would dislodge remoue another countrey battell ended day kill enemy resisted skirmish rest kinred meanes peril cause whatsoeuer thereby driuen neglect lawes depart ordinance thereof whether one kinred citie whatsoeuer would seeke alter disturbe striue weaken estate thereof particular sortes corne barley contemptible amongst nation asia day people found disgraced contemned israelite respect resembled barley day seemeth encourage gedeon army whereas cake turned ouerthrow tent feare rashnes disorder sacrificing saul excused himselfe alledging staied terme seuen day appointed vrging necessitie depart soldiours together feare aduerse army machmas intelligence receiued samuel gone galgal induced offer sacrifice samuel replied saying thou hadst done aduisedly thou hadst obeyed contemned god thine ouerhaste whose minister prophet thine obedience thou mightest haue gotten assurance continuance thy kingdome thy selfe succession thy posteritie said displeased hapned retired backe owne house saul sixe hundreth soldier onely accompanied sonne ionathan yeare world 2880 natiuitie christ 1084 hedio ruffinus galgala palestine spoile countrey hebrewes came vnto citie gabeon greater part men disarmed reason countrey intirely destitute iron workemen expert skilfull forging making armour philistine permitted haue haue declared little diuiding army three battels inuaded countrey hebrewes many way destroying foraging thing sight king saul son neither could inhibite incursion reason multitude make head therefore sonne achias high priest sate downe vpon hillocke seeing countrey spoyled round much dismaied saul sonne conspired concluded esquire harnessebearer enter secretly enemy campe raise vprore allarum willingly promising 1 reg 14 ionathan harnes bearer doe priuily enter enemy campe offering seruice aduenture occasion place hazard life descended mountaine marched directly towards enemy campe pitched tent hie pointed rocke extended selfe length three angle way begirt banke wall fortification incursion enemy cause kept watch somewhat carelesly place fortified nature man might ascend assaile disaduantage therefore gotten neere vnto campe ionathan incouraged companion animated assaile enemy manner saith espie v v ascend let v take sommons assured token victorie hold peace call v let v returne backe againe therefore approched enemy host beginning brie day philistine said one vnto hebrewes creepe caues den cried ionathan harnessebearer saying come hither come hither vnto v end may plague according audacious enterprise saul sonne quickly taking hold word esteeming ominous assured token victorie departed esquire place first discouered answering would shortly visit withdrawing himselfe side rocke reason scituation thereof left vnguarded ouercomming difficultie place great labour last attained place enemy found asleepe assailing ionathan slayeth certaine number enimies camp rest inuade one another put flight slew twenty filled whole army terrour amasednesse casting away weapon fled amain ignorant either friend foe inuaded one another enemy imagining themselues onely two hebrewes durst neuer ascend enter campe addressed themselues mutuall murther slaughter slaine others fled escape sword fell headlong downe rockes king espial told confusion disorder befallen campe philistine saul demaunded whether companie absent hearing sonne harnessebearer missing commanded high priest attired pontificall ornamens prophecie hedio ruffinus chap 7 saul hearing tumult palestine campe sallieth vpon thē succeede assuring obtaine victorie ouer enemy sallied assaulted philistine ran vpon thus confused disordered whetted one flocked great multitude time fled den place vnder ground soone heard victorie inclined saul side gathering togither number often thousand hebrewes pursued scattered enemy thorow countrey afterward great inconuenient hapned vnto saul proceeding ioy conceiued victorie commonly blessed good fortune master owne affection reason rather proceeding ignorance intending saciate himselfe reuenge iniuries receiued philistine published imprecation curse amongst hebrewes one whomsoeuer intermitting chase slaughter take sustenance night purposing vntill darke night neither giue ouer pursuit slaughter execration thus published saul chanced sonne yet heard imprecation father generall ratification allowance people saul edict vnwittingly broken ionathan falling certaine groue belonging tribe ephraim wherein many swarm bee chance light vpon hony combe pressing hony thereout afterwards eat afterwards hauing intelligence father vnder grieuous penaltie execration forbidden man taste sort meate sunne set gaue ouer eating yet said father done amisse therein publishing prohibition reason yeare world 2880 christ birth 1084 receiued sustenance might greater force forwardnesse pursue enemy fled ouertake slaughter greater number killing therefore many thousand palestine partie euening began ransacke spoyle campe philistine bore away thence great spoyles wonderfull number cattell part slaine eaten bloud contrarie lawe scribe certified signified king people offended god hebrewes feed bloudy flesh slaughtering beast eating flesh either washt purified bloud saul commanded great stone rowled midst place commanded people kill sacrifice beast vpon forbeare eate flesh bloud agreeable vnto god performed according king commanded saul erected altar place offered burnt sacrifice vnto god first altar erected saul desirous incontinently assaile enemy campe sacke therein day spring whilest men warre diligently followed shewed great forwardnes execution command king asked counsaile high priest achitob whether god would giue victorie permit enter enemy campe returne thence victorie high priest certified god returned answere vnderstood without cause said god thus silent heretofore wont giue willing answere ought doe must need hidden sinne v breeding offence procureth silent sweare god although mine owne sonne ionathan hath committed sinne end may appease god lesse seueritie execute one stranger neither alliance affinitie tied vnto people cried encouraged performance spoken presently assembled one place standing saul trieth lot hath displeased god sonne apart began casting lot find faultie lot fell ionathan asked committed crime owne conscience guiltie answered know thing yesterday pursuit enemy ignorant thine edict tasted hony combe saul swore would slay setting oath either kinred nature affection saul intendeth kil owne sonne prepared resolute die nothing astonished present perill generous dreadlesse mind presented himselfe reply father saith intreat fauour thy hand willingly submit death may discharge thee thy vow contentedly haue seene famous victorie shall die thorowly contented see insolencie palestine ouermastred power hebrewes valour courage yoong man moued whole multitude remorse commiseration swore would suffer ionathan author famous victorie slaine israelite rescue ionathan displeased father therefore rescued yoong man displeased father made vowes vnto god end might pardon fault saul slaine sixtie thousand enemy returned victorie owne home raigned afterwards happily ouercame force ammonite philistine moabites idumeans amalechites king oba dwelt neere three sonnes ionathan iosuah melchi two daughter merob michal generall army abner sonne vnckle called ner oba soba ner ci saul father brother sonnes abiel verie rich horse chariot whatsoeuer enemy marched forth alwaies returned victorie reduced affaire hebrewes happy estate much increased saul alwaies conquerour power weare feared nation neighboured vpon chiefest youth either preuailed cause behooued obedient vnto thing ruled people god king kingdomes thing thus therefore said hee doth god command thee since amalechites offered many iniuries vnto hebrewes yeare world 2883 christ birth 1081 samuel god commandement addresseth saul make warre vpon amalechites saul mustring people findeth tribe iuda onely thirtie thousand men desert whilest departure aegypt trauelled region inhabite behooueth thee punish iust warre hauing ouercome thou vtterly extinguish memorie without regard either sex yeares reuenge shalt thou execute vpon repaiment iniuries time past offered forefather neither shalt thou spare either beast horse flocke apply thy profit particular vse thou shalt consecrate vnto god according moses commanded deface name amalechites earth thing saul promise performe supposing obedience consisted onely acting also speedie execution enioyned presently assembled force togither mustring souldiers galgal found fortie thousand besides tribe iuda selfe affoorded allowed thirty thousand chosen men saul enter countrey amalechites layd diuers ambush neere vnto riuer onely afflict open hostile warre also enclose surprise vnwares kill amidst hie way charged therefore put flight discomfited saul raseth city amalechites whole army pursuing fled execution hauing answerable successe according god promised marched onwards besieged city amalechites ouercame batterie mine countermures raised outside famine thirst diuers way city ouercame neither spared woman child neither supposing murther cruell neither inhumane first executed vpon enemie next nothing according god commandement towards disobedience might redound vtter ouerthrow tooke agag prisoner also king saul taketh agag king amalechites prisoner keepeth aliue contrarie god commandement amalechites whose beautie personage seemed vnto well proportioned perfect wondred thereat thought worthy kept aliue god commandement ouercome owne affection vsurping vpon vngranted priuiledge mercie owne preiudice god hated amalechites spared infant ought naturall compassion haue beene pitied rest saul kept aliue king enemy author hebrewes euils setting beauty god commandement sinne people presently imitated spared horse kind cattell made pray notwithstanding god charged reserue nothing caried away moueables rich people contrarie god ordained driue away horse cattell amalechites consumed thing smalest valew fire victorie saul ouer people dwell betwixt pelusium citie border aegypt vnto red sea medled sichemites inhabite midst madianites battell commaunded retire themselues least partake calamity amalechites allied vnto reason raguel moses father lawe hebrewes cause procure safetie saul hauing obtained victorie reioycing good successe returned owne home full content pretermitted nothing god commanded prophet samuel warre amalechites precisely obserued enioyned god sore displeased king amalechites preserued people made pray cattell action hedio ruffinus chap 9 god displeased saul disobdience expressely god permission tolerated mortall king neglect contemne lawes decree whose onely meanes furthered fauoured victorie cause god told prophet samuel repented chosen saul king considering infringed commandements gouerned himselfe according owne appetite samuel heard word sore troubled besought god night long would appease wrath displeasure conceiued saul notwithstanding al importunity samuel striueth reconcile saul vnto god praiers prophet made god would sort reconciled inconuenient sinnes committed saul remitted samuel submission intercession sinne neuer augmenteth increaseth offenced remisse punishment whilest would reputed much indulgence lenity confirmeth wicked vngodlines good mercifull themselues vnwares vnwitting become author sinne therefore god denied prophet request manifestly appeared praiers supplication might appease soone day samuel repaired saul time remained galgal soone king apperceiued ranne vnto yeare world 2883 christ natiuitie 1081 embraced saying giue god thankes victorie thing hee commanded haue performed samuel replied said commeth passe heare bleating sheepe bellowing beast thorow army saul answered people reserued cattell sacrifice besides nation amalechites exterminated according god commanded one remaining onelie reserued king would cause presented end might consult togither done hereunto prophet answered god tooke pleasure sacrifice good iust said according commandement since action samuel chideth saul may reputed good respect reference hath god god refuseth sacrificeth disobeyeth willingly accepteth sacrifice offered vnto submit themselues vnto offer vnto true onely offering yea though present diuers many great sacrifice contempt god wherein consisteth pleasing acceptable sacrifice vnto god bring sundrie iewels gold siluer reiecteth thing respecteth pledge pietie testimony wickednesse taketh pleasure onely obserue hath pronounced commanded making choise rather die way infringe seeking sacrifice offered vnto offered although small valew yet acceptable vnto pouertie obedience richest hand strongest fortune affoord way know thou therefore said thou hast incurd god displeasure thou hast contemned neglected commandements canst thou thinke regard thy sacrifice gracious eie hee himselfe hath adiudged vtter perdition ruine except thou thinke offer thinges vnto god effect lesse seeke death assured therefore losse thy kingdome power samuel telleth saul god displeasure losse kingdome saul cōfesseth sinne craueth pardō withstanding denied hath sort transported thee thou hast contemned god bestowed vpon thee saul confessed sinned done amisse hee obeyed word prophet yet alleadged compelled doe durst restraine souldier whet kindled vpon pray said fauourable mercifull vnto take heede least fall like sinne besought would stay long whilest might offer peace offering behalfe foresaw knew god would mooued sacrifice began depart chap ix samuel proclaimed dauid king bvt saul willing retaine samuel tooke hold garment prophet saul striuing stay samuel rent •… th garment hastily withdrew himselfe tore away part thereof reason samuel violently withdrew himselfe sinned impossible recal done notwithstanding besought presence people would yet doe honor time walke cast presence god samuel condescended vnto went adore god agag king amalechites brought samuel much delighted presence whereunto condescended permitting dwell king chap x yeare world 2883 christes natiuity 1081 second expedition palestine hebrewes long time philistine assembled themselues gathered together hedio ruffinus chap 11 1 reg 17 another expedition palestine hebrewes goliah man prodigious statute amongst palestine great company men warre assailed israelite subdued betweene sucoth azeca incamped saul side led forth army encamping himselfe vpon certaine mountaine constrained philistine dislodge first campe entrench themselues vpon mountaine right ouer pitched tent campes thus separated one valley extended selfe betweene army descended certaine man called goliah gittite huge stature foure cubit span length height hauing limmes couered huge mightie armour curet bare backe waighed fiue thousand sicles helmet pouldrons brasse made fit couer massie mēbers speare bare hand light lance bare shoulder head therof waighed 600 sicles followed diuers men bearing armes came betwixt army stood vp cried loud voice addressing speach saul hebrewes termes hebrewes goliah challēgeth single combate hebrewes hand need hazard doubtfull fortune warre single aduersary let v determine two hazard whose side victorie conquest shal fall whosoeuers soldiour shall ouer come let partie adiudged subiect side haue victorie better one among whole armie brought hazard spoken thus returned backe owne camp next day came forth againe vsed word thus fortie day space ceased defie hebrewes like word vnder condition saul army displeased kept themselues alwaies readie arraunged battell although fight begunne neither side time saul addressed himselfe expedition sent dauid backe againe iesse father contenting himselfe three brother time serued vnder royall standard whereas intended intermitted care saul sendeth dauid backe againe father keeping flock whilst warre rather protracted performed whether father sent carie victual brother know affaire went armie whilest dauid deuized brother touching thing father committed charge heard philistine blaspheming rayling vpon hebrew armie therewith greatly moued turning himselfe vnto brother told dauid desireth fight goliah readie addrest fight hand hand enemie eliab elder brother reproued speaking telling hardie became age knew concerned matter willing returne vnto father intend flock dauid reuerence bare vnto brother departed thence meeting certaine soldier said vnto wil encounter proud challenger presently signified vnto saul incontinently sent seeke came presence asked intended doe king said let thy courage abated thy feare ouermaster thee abate pride enemie encounter enter combate great high soeuer clate fierce soeuer shew himselfe subdue turne terrour derision much shall thy glorie honour thy army enhanced much great expert man armes shall subdued young man vnexperienced souldier saul amased hardines great courage yet notwithstanding suspecting reason yeares told feeble encounter man expert helmet sent forth battell dauid feeling waight armour seeming rather loaded defenced said vnto let armes king serue inclose defence thy body art able beare suffer beseech thee thy seruant fight concerned saul alwaies shewed himselfe obedient againe neuer ceased warre vpon enemy god assistance beene fortunate thing cause saul displeased prophet informed saul iniustice forsooke citie ramath sent others seeing third companie prophecie likewise end much despited came thither owne person drew neere place samuel saw made prophecie saul comming towards seased aboundance spirit rauished himselfe hauing despoyled himselfe raiment lay dauid complaineth vnto ionathan father iniuries ionathā exculeth father prostrate day night long presence samuel dauid dauid departed thence went vnto ionathan complained ambush father laid intrap telling notwithstanding neuer committed either iniurie fault father yet earnestly pursue put death ionathan perswaded neither rashly suspect thing ouercredulous report perhaps might brought vnto trust onely assured father intended euill would haue told neuer wont act thing without counsell dauid sware vnto besought would beleeue vnfained assertiōs wherby might easily procure securitie least contemning word supposing fained friuolous death ascertained sight truth thereof assured father cause communicate counsailes assured loue friendship betweene ionathan sore aggrieued dauid perswaded dauid desired ionathan sound father affected towards saul intention asked desired hand wherein might shew friendship dauid said vnto know protestation perswaded haue cause feare commanded raise spirit samuel knowing samuel saul commandeth witch raise samuel ghost called hell sodainly appeared perceiued honourable man diuine semblance sore troubled wholy discomforted vision turned said vnto king art thou saul samuel certified lesse saul confessed asked cause seemed much troubled answered saw man ascend resembled god saul commanded declare vnto shape habite age gaue vnderstand reuerend olde man attired vestment high priest markes saul knew samuel whereupon prostrating himselfe earth adored saluted spirit samuel asked cause troubled raised complained saul complaineth misery samuel asketh aduise lamented inforced thereunto necessitie grieuous host enemy hand void counsaile forsaken god hauing prediction either prophecie dreame cause said made recourse vnto thee hast alwaies care fortune samuel foreseeing king death hard hand answered vaine question touching thing happen since thou knowest thou art forsaken god know therfore samuel ghost certifieth saul euent battell philistine said dauid shall possesse kingdome shall establish estate armes concerning thy selfe thou shalt lose thy kingdome thy life thou hast disobeyed god thy warre amalechites hast obserued commandements according foretold thee time aliue know therefore thy people host shall discomfited enemy thou thy son shall morrow slaine battell saul vnderstood thing became speechlesse thorow sorrow wherewith seased fell downe pauement either force failed thorow sodaine griefe want meat saul sodain sorrow sel swoun enchantres intreateth refresh himselfe take refection neither night day vouchsafed body refection sustenance length hardly recouering himselfe swoun woman importuned receiue sustenance beseeching doe fauour recompence vnexpected diuination though interdicted aduentured performe sake ascertained forbidden consideration wherof prayed sitting downe table would refresh himselfe sustenance end might able returne vnto army although resisted vtterly refused eat appetite vtterly desperate yet effectually importuned finally perswaded receiue little nourishment whereas shee one calfe example courtesie liberalitie enchantresse bred vp house particular care poore woman rich yet spared kill dresse flesh saul seruants thus refected saul returned backe againe campe curtesie woman deserueth praised although knew king prohibited art whereby family sufficiently maintained themselues although time neuer seene saul yet without remembring art bin condemned entertained stranger like man neuer seene compassion comforted exhorting eate although refused presented willingly hartily little pouertie vnder hope recompence expected preferment knowing well saul shortly lose life according ordinarie course men naturally honour haue bestowed dignitie vpon become seruiceable pretend draw profit hereafter therefore ought imitated appeareth excellent example bountie approuing nothing worthie praise relieue yeare world 2890 christ natiuitie 1074 necessitie neither thing becomming men whereby may obtaine god fauour grace better thus much sufficeth present respect woman methinketh shall vvell insert place vvritings another eaxmple report aggrauated achitophel reuolteth dauid followeth absalon whose counsails dauid striueth praier make frustrate chusai perswaded submit absalon achitophels counsel increased griefe besought god might please alienate affection absalon achitophel feare least giue sinister counsel might easily perswaded thereunto achitophel man ripe iudgement readie execution concerned soone came vnto top mountaine beheld citie vtterly beene banished kingdome began abundant teares call vpon god met chusai sincere vnfained friend beheld garment rent ash head lamenting vnhappie chaunge beheld dauid cause thus desperatly bent v neither wondred suffer outrage since mine owne sonne wicked taketh felicitie disdaine may god wil haue compassion v please shal haue vpper hand ouer enimies therfore went bethleem hauing drawne water returned backe vnto king sallying thorow midst enemy bringing newes philistine affraid hardinesse great courage kept themselues vpon guard daring charge togither one chamber fortuned v one day houre bare v sonne three day brought bed woman lying infant hath sleepe ouerlaid stifled hath taken childe betweene knee laid setled dead childe whilest slept bosome morrow thought offer teate vnto mine infant found mine owne perceiued child lay dead knew exactly marked childe haue redemaunded hand could recouer haue made recourse vnto maiesties iustice sent vnto hiram certaine subtill question demaunding exposition dius salomon thereof vnder condition declared way penaltie hee pay great summe money afterwards certaine tyrian called abdimon expounded beene proposed lieu thereof proposed certaine others salomon could expound occasion paid great summe money vnto hiram dius writeth king seeing citie wanted bulwark tower secure strength way answerable dignitie thereof repaired walles salomon repaireth wals ierusalem erecteth tower hedio ruffinus chap 6 salomon buildeth certaine city azor magedon gaza erected great tower moreouer builded certaine city deserue memorized among renowmed namely asor magedon third citie gaza country philistine pharao king aegypt led army tooke force put inhabitant thereof sword destroyed afterwards gaue dower vnto daughter maried salomon cause king fortified seeing alreadie sufficiently defenced nature stood verie commodiously warre hinder inuasions enemie might happen farre thence fortified two city whereof one called betachor baleth besides builded others city recreation pleasure reason good temperature ayre pleasantnes fruit especiall betachor baleth sweet streamie riuers wherewith watered afterwards entering desart aboue syria cōquering builded great city two day iourney distant higher syria day iourney euphrates sixe great babylon cause citie inhabited farre ciuill peopled quarter syria place lower countrey water found citie fountaines spring therefore builded citie begirt strong walles called thadamor name syrian tearme euen day amongst greekes called palmyra salomon work time thadamor palmyra diuers demaund question commeth passe king aegypt haue beene since minaeus founder memphis raigned diuers yeeres egyptian king called pharaoh great ancestor abraham say haue beene till salomon time space thirteene hundred yeeres haue beene called pharaoh deriuing name one raigned mid time betweene haue thought requisite manifest intent resolue doubt expresse cause name name pharao amongst yeare world 2953 christ birth 1011 egyptian king called pharaoh ptolemei caesares herodotus writeth name egyptiā king nicaule queen egypt ethiop commeth salomon aegyptians signifieth much king thinke childhood distinct name afterwards created king take vpon name mother toong signifieth lesse authoritie king alexandria hauing time called name time introduced kingdome called ptolemy name first king romaine emperours likewise notwithstanding haue name time birth yet called caesar soueraigntie honour whereunto raised imposeth title name giuen father retained cause thinke although herodotus halicarnasseus saith since minos founder memphis haue three hundreth thirtie king aegypt yet declareth name called pharaoh woman obtained kingdome calleth owne proper name nicaule whence appeareth men haue king vsually called name communicated vnto woman cause necessarie declare owne first name mine owne part haue found bookes nation since pharao father law salomon one king aegypt haue called name little aforenamed woman came vnto salomon raigned aegypt aethiopia little wil make discourse present haue made mention make knowne record chronicle aegyptians accord many thing king salomon conquered chanaanites till time vnder sub iection inhabited mountaine libanus farre citie amath made tributary chose amongst euerie yeare might employ 3 reg 10 salomon compelleth remainder chananites pay tribute seruile action domesticall businesse tillage sand one hebrew slaue neither conuenient since god subiected diuers nation vnder might make slaues tie owne nation bondage employed armes rather recourse vnto praiers yet could moue god incline fauour victorie prophet samaeas threatned told god would abandon like sort forsaken seruice heard sodainly lost heart seeing meanes escape began confesse god iustly forsaken shewed impietie peruerted lawes god seeing thus disposed making confession sinnes said vnto prophet would vtterly destroy yet notwithstanding would deliuer hand aegyptians tribe thus thing terminated behooueth present declare ieroboam afterwards died obseruing meane end impietie imployed himselfe continually making altar high place presumed ordaine common sacrificer god apparrel selfe like common woman afterwards go achias prophet assuring admirable knowledge foretelling thing come foretold king cause willed repaire vnto manner straunger enquire sonne escape sicknes whereupon disguised selfe according husband commaunded came vnto citie silo achias dwelt vpon entring house notwithstanding hee lost sight thorow age god appeared vnto certified two point first ieroboams wife came vnto next answere demaund time therefore entred house guise common straunge woman achias cried loud voice enter thou wife ieroboam wherefore hidest thou thy selfe thou canst hide thy selfe god hath certified thy comming hath informed aunswere shall giue vnto thee therefore said vnto returne vnto husband certifie god answere effect little nothing thou wert haue made thee great hauing dismembred kingdome dauids posteritie haue giuen vnto thee thou hast forgotten hauing forsaken seruice hast molten downe new god thou punishmēt ieroboam misery people foreprophecied honourest also exterminate thee abolish thy posteritie cast pray vnto dog fowles ayre wil constitute king ouer people shall leaue one ieroboams race aliue people also shall haue part punishment shall depriued fruitfull countrey scattered among region side euphrates haue followed impiety king adoring god forged haue giuen ouer sacrifice concerning thy selfe woman haste thee certifie thy husband thing thou shalt find thy sonne dead sooner shalt thou enter citie shall finish day shall buried lamentation whole people generall onely good race ieroboam achias finished prophecie woman started backe sore homeward behooued vse expedition behalfe husband whenas therefore arriued found sonne expiring prophet foretold recited rest vnto ieroboam chap v yeare world 2988 christ natiuitie 976 ieroboams expedition sonne roboam ouerthrow armie basanes rooted whole posteritie ieroboam made himselfe king bvt ieroboam nothing moued herewith leuied great armie intent alias chap 6 expedition ieroboam abias king iuda abias leuied army ieroboam make warre abias sonne roboam obtained father kingdome ouer two tribe despised young yeares notwithstanding young king whit dismaide although vnderstood ieroboams comming greater wisedome incident yeares beyond expectation forward aduersarie leuied armie two tribe encountred ieroboam mountaine samaria incamping host neere vnto prouided thing readinesse requisite battell foure hundreth thousand fighting men ieroboam twise many army arranged expected giue allarum charge abias stood vp certaine high place whence might seene heard making signe hand required ieroboam people would first al heare peaceably granted one attēding silence brake word none knoweth god hath promised kingdome dauid posteritie euer therefore greatly admire abias oration hebrewes wherein vpbraideth superstition forsaking religion haue reuolted father submit selues ieroboam seruant present accompany warre god hath ordained raigne take kingdome greater part whereof ieroboam vsurpeth iniustly euen day suppose shall enioy long time shall punished god shall cease contradict lawes dishonour doth continually perswading like haue receiued iniurie father hand reason misled sinister counsails certaine wicked person spake vnto certain word apparance seemed vnfitting eares haue forsaken displeasure effect haue separated selues god commaundements truly haue pardoned young man vntrained vntaught oratorie rude word vsed although youth ignorance haue moued commit churlish indiscreet action errour yet haue endured father demerites ought serue satisfie childrens defect haue regard neither present leade forth great army v whereupon ground hope victorie calues gold altar mountaines witness impietie irreligion great number surpasseth farre maketh confident truly force many thousand value whereas army fighteth vniust quarrell onely iustice pietie towards god consisteth assured hope obtaining victory ouer man enemy must need side obserue time ordinance seruices god men hand haue fashioned corruptible matter subtiltie cunning king could forge deceiue communaltie one whose worke beginning ending thing therefore aduise presently repent selues taking better way desist warre acknowledge lawes forefather finally ordinance haue aduanced great felicitie thus spake abias people whilest yet continued discourse ieroboam sent certaine soldier byway inclose abias within two strieghts follower could discouer abias thus inclosed midst enemy army began discomforted lose courage incouraged exhorted put trust god could enclosed enemy together hauing called vpon god liued certaine prophet called naum hedio ruffinus chap 7 prophecy destruction niniue naum 2 prophecied ouerthrow assyrian citie niniue spake effect people thereof shall tossed troubled put flight shall say one vnto stay abide take gold siluer shall none receiue shall haue care saue body good shall great debate amongst lamentation member shal lose vigor face shall altogether swart thorow feare shal repaire lion shal mother lion whelpe rest niniue god saith vnto thee destroy thee neither shall lion issue thee gouerne world effect prophecy spake many thing intent concerneth repeat haue omitted purposely would troublesome reader thing forespoke touching niniue came passe one hundreth fifteene yeares sufficient manifestation matter chap xii yeare world 3204 natiuitie christ 760 rasin chanaanites perpetrated diuers like offence impious idolatry rasin king syria damasco phaceias king israel made warre two confederate leading therefore army ierusalem besieged long time yet profited nothing reason walles verie strong king syria hauing seazed citie elath neere vnto red sea slaine inhabitant thereof planted syrian therein putting garrison punishment impietie esay 7 likewise sword iewes round carried away great bootie damasco afterwards returned home armie king ierusalem vnderstanding syrian retired supposing himselfe bee sufficient fight king israel led forth force ouercome 4 reg 16 battell god incensed wickedness detestable infinite battell israelite slue sixescore thousand men amongst zacharias sonne achaz generall armie israelite slaughter army iuda called amia slue farre mightie power woman woman king bred brought world men plant vineyard wine doe grow borne nourished woman generally thing enioy weaue v garment haue care custody house neither possible v seuered citizen ierusalem daily high way found full dead body hereupon nehemias yeare world 3519 christ natiuitie 445 began weepe thorow inward compassion distressed brother looking vp towards heauen long sate aloft holding hand golden scepter whensoeuer intended saue life one approched throne vncalled stretched forth touched therewith thus touched mean auoided penaltie death touching thing haue sufficiently spoken place long bagathous theodestes two king eunuch conspired barnabazus hebrew nation one seruants disclosing treason discouered queenes vncle mardocheus meanes made king priuy conspiracie sore troubled herewith found truth examination commanded executed gibbet time gaue recompence mardocheus safegard life onely commanded name registred chronicled commentary commanding attend pallace esteemed one king inward friend often aman sonne amadath amalechite came vnto pallace visite king either persian aman being▪ ho •… ured men neglected iewes esther 3 trangers according king especiall direction honour mardocheus shewed honour reason vpright iudgement also lawes iewes f •… bade aman obserued demaunded whence vnderstanding iew much displeased saying himselfe persian freer condition cast themselues prostrate slaue disdained like intending therfore reuenge himselfe mardocheus thought sufficient procure punishment king hand resolued wholy exterminate race nature capitall enemy iewes reason amalechites challenged descent wholy ruinated cause addressed himselfe vnto king accused saying certaine cursed nation spred thorow whole kingdome insociable abhorring customes men vsed diuers lawes ceremony hatefull manner study rest subiects mortall men nation saith thou wilt doe gratious acceptable fauour vnto thy people thou shalt vtterly extinguish leaue neither captiue slaue aliue amongst least maiesties tribute way impaired meanes promise mine owne reuenewes forne thousand talent siluer desiring rather willingly forbeare much money kingdome vnpurged cursed race men aman made request king answered forgaue de •… ruction iewes granted vnto aman money permitted deale nation best liked aman obtained desire presently sent edict thorow nation king name effect great king artaxerxes vnto gouernours hundreth seuen twenty prouinces extending india farre aethiopia health hauing obtained empire ouer many nation extended dominion ouer world according mine owne pleasure without constrained offend subiects vsing power proudly importunately becommeth v shewing selues fauourable mercifull prouiding peace plentifull estate haue searched meanes thereof intent might perceiue fruit therefore admonished friend aman wisedome iustice honoured others approued fidelitie hath second place authoritie next mee certaine race men intermedled among enemy humanitie vsing none owne lawes different others disobedient king depraued manner customes neither allow monarchie affaire command made knowne aman man hold deere father slaine wiues child spare none published euerie citie men addressed themselues prefixed day vtterly exterminate iewes le diligence vsed sufan metropolitane city meane king aman feasted made good cheere whilest citie hung yeare world 3549 christ birth 415 lamentation iewes vpon hearing edict esther 4 suspence troubled expectation euent follow mardocheus hauing intelligence hereof rent garment put sackcloth cast ash head walking thorow citie cry nation committed crime deserued death vsing like speech came vnto king pallace stood gate vnlawfull enter thereinto habit like also iewes city edict beene published weeping lamenting misery newes hereof brought vnto queene mardocheus stood pallace gate lamentable estate sore troubled sent certain seruants vnto cōmand exchange attire could perswade put sackcloth inconueniēt put ouerpast therefore called vnto eunuch acratheus sent vnto mardocheus know hatefull accident befallen made put desolate habit poure forth lamentable teares notwithstanding instantly praied disrobe one dry vp hereupon mardocheus told eunuch edict made iewes sent king vnto prouinces offer money aman likewise tendered king whereby bought vtter ruine nation king hand yeare world 3 •… 54 christ birt •… 410 moreouer gaue copie beene proclaimed susan deliuered vnto esther commaunded beseech king esteeme dishonour put abiect base garment saue nation preserue iewes death whereunto time exposed aman next honour king accused iewes incensed maiestie esther vnderstood sent againe vnto mardocheus giuing vnderstand called king whosoeuer entred vnto called die except king would warrantize stretching golden scepter vnto king extended fauour although called vnto yet suffered death obtained pardon thing reported eunuch esther vnto mardocheus commanded tell hir ought much tender particular respect life liues whole nation assuring hir present care succour wholy proceed god meanes father house destroyed contemned vpon reply esther sent messenger backe againe vnto mardocheus commaunding repaire vnto susan fasting praiers vnto god safetie people call generall assembly iewes remained willing three day space fast abstaine kind meat safetie selfe seruants would doe like promising time would present selfe king notwithstanding contrarie edict must need die would willingly endure mardocheus following direction caused people fast pray vnto god likewise himselfe besought might please present haue compassion desolate destressed nation time oftentimes care pardoned time offended also present would deliuer perdition denounced daunger die infamously offence owne onely incensed aman vnto displeasure would adore performe honour vnto onely due god cause despite hath imagined thing would transgresse diuine ordinance people likewise praied like effect beseeching god would haue care preseruation warrantize israelite place soeuer misery hand eies alreadie expected esther also besought god according countrey manner casting selfe prostrate earth clothed sackcloth abstaining three day space meat drinke thing soeuer else delectable beseeching god haue compassion vpon presented selfe king might haue word fit perswade mollifie grace beautie farre amiable euer end two meanes might better enabled appease king displeased succour brother agitated tossed extreme daunger wherethrough king might enforce hatred enemy iewes take compassion esther resorteth king solicite bahalfe iewes imminent daunger without preuention would surely fall vpon sort three day space fasted praied cast mourning attire changed habite attiring selfe like maiesticall queene hauing two seruants leaned third followed carried vp top finger yeare world 3554 christ birth 410 traine large trailed ground equipage came vnto king hauing cheek stained crimson blush making shew maiestie mixed beautie altogither estranged feare beheld king sitting aloft throne glorious garment distinguisht gold adorned pearle rich stone certaine feare sodainly fell vpon chance cast frowning yreful looke whereupon presently astonished member failed colour faded fel betwixt handmaid armes swoune hereon king god verily esteeme chaunged affection suspecting least feare cause wife fall grieuous accident sodainly lept throne embrasing armes raised vp kissed spake comfortable word vnto praying good courage suspect sinister misfortune came vnto without motion ordinance onely made subiects cause willed equall gouemment seare nothing whereupon tooke scepter hand laid queenes necke according law enforcing himselfe deliuer feare meanes recouered vigour courage spake manner king said cannot easily expresse vnto inconuenience sodainly fallen vpon soone beheld great faire redoubted maiestie person spirit forsooke heart failed whilest spake word paine feeblenesse king touched compassion animated encouraged commaunded expect nothing good yea said thou demaundest halfe kingdome grant thee esther onely requested hand onely intire friend aman would vouchsafe grace presence banquet king readily granted come vnto banquet midst cup king commaunded esther aske would would grant assuring would refuse nothing yea although demaunded halfe kingdome deferred discouer suit vntill next day requiring repaire aman vnto banquet king promised reuisit aman departed great ioy alone credit banquet king esther euer obtained like honour amongst king dominion returne perceiuing mardocheus court sore moued notwithstanding lookt vpon done honour therefore came home vnto house called zaraza wife friend told honour onely king queene also done onely king supped day queene inuited next day also banquet king notwithstanding told discontented saw mardocheus iew court zaraza amans hatred mardochaeus wife told cause gallowes raised fiftie cubit high next day demaund licence king mardocheus might hanged gibbet aman praising wiues counsel commaunded seruants prepare timber erect gallowes court end hang mardocheus thereon diligently performed god mocked amans cursed hope knowing certainly happen tooke pleasure see prepared verie night depriued king sleepe verie loth spend time idlely whilest awake imploy thing profitable kingdome commaunded secretarie bring chronicle king alaudable custome king esther 6 predecessor thing done himselfe read therefore brought read found certaine man whose name set downe receiued great possession reward reacknowledgment vertue red likewise obtained recompence fidelitie consequently others till last came place eunuch bagotheus theodestes noted downe secret conspiracie person king discouered mardocheus secretarie hauing onely recited accident turned ouer historie king staied asked found therein written giuen recompence mardocheus answered found nothing set whereupon king commanded giue ouer inquired office appertained houre night knowing morning alreadie discouered commaunded one certifie familiar attended pallace time chanced aman found repaired thither sooner accustomed intent beseech king might lawfull put mardocheus death yeare th •… world 3554 natiuitie christ 410 officer brought king tydings aman pallace commanded presently call soone came king presence said vnto knowing thou art affectionate onely friend prithee giue thy counsaile may condignly honour according greatnesse doe affectionately loue aman thinking aduice giue giuen himselfe supposed beloued king others counsailed opinion best manner said intend inuest man glorie say beloued cause mounted vpon braue horse let apparelled royall habit put chaine gold necke let one thy chiefest friend march proclaime thorow citie thus man honoured king loueth aman gaue counsaile hoped owne fortune king highly contented aduise turning towards spake thus vnto thou hast horse garment chaine seeke therefore iewe mardocheus giue match thou making publike crie said thou art mine inward friend verie decent execution thing committed thy trust thou hast faithfully counsailed commaund done sort mardocheus hath preseruer life aman hearing word beyond al expectation confused spirit wholy discomforted knew way turne therefore issued hauing horse purple habite chaine gold meeting therefore mardocheus pallace cloathed sackcloth enioyned lay mourning habite aside cloath himselfe purple wholy ignorant hapned supposing mocked said thou wickedest man amongst men doest thou thus mocke affliction notwithstanding afterwards informed king bestowed honour sauing honour offered mardochaeus life discouering trecherie eunuch would haue slaine put vpon scarlet habite king wore ordinarily put chaine necke afterwards mounting horse went round citie aman also walking cry thus dealt done king honoured loued thought worthy estimation circuited whole citie mardocheus gaue attendance king aman came presence much ashamed hapned cause repaired home told wife friend teares hapned told way possible reuenge esiher 7 himselfe yet mardocheus god whilest discoursing debating matter togither esther eunuch came hasten aman banquet sabuchadas one eunuch seeing gibbet erected amans lodging whereon intended execute mardocheus demanded one seruants wherefore raised vp vnderstanding queenes vncle aman would require king hand end might put death time held peace king seated aman banquet required queene declare would require might grant began lament danger hir people saying whole nation made pray sword cause brake discourse said troubled maiestie neither agrieued commanded iewes sold led away captiues extreme miserie affliction might haue borne therefore praied redeeme misery therefore king demaunded practised tyrannic began publikely accuse aman saying alone wretched enuious man complotted tragedie hereupon king verie sore troubled rose banquet depart garden began aman pray beseech esther forgiue offence present dāgerous estate aman hauing trecheries cruelty discouered banquet adiudged gallowes whilest fallen vpon bed beseech fauour king entred grew displeased saw said thou cursed amongst men darst thou attempt enforce wife aman wholy confounded question word answere hereupon eunuch sabuchadas stepping forth accused found lodging erecting gibbet mardocheus assuring king one houshold seruants told time sent call banquet alleadging moreouer gibbet fiftie cubit hie king vnderstood adiudged aman death intended mardocheus thereupon presently commanded yeare world 3554 christ birth 410 esther 8 hanged vpon gibbet vntill dead place pardon considering actes word spoken notorious vnto men aman amadathite amalechite nation meanes stranger persian bloud entertained v hath thing enioyed fruit bountie hitherto hath called father 3684 natiuitie christ 280 v deceiue selues dissimulation necessarily importeth v discouer truth whereas haue concluded selues onely transcript also translate lawes iewes rather performe acceptable seruice grace honest pretext left v attaine thereunto long great number iewes kept thraldome thy kingdome shall therefore doe worke answerable greatnes courage benignitie deliuer miserie considering gaue lawes god gouerneth kingdome diligent inquisition haue certainly apprehended wee adore one god creator thing call name iupiter forasmuch maintaineth life liues men honour therefore owe vnto god send backe people countrey permit inhabite amongst al men singularly affected religion neither hath grace occasion suspect offer supplication praiers vnto fauour profit either allied descended tribe whereas one god maker men selfe assured taketh pleasure men addict themselues beneficence onely cause induceth make request vnto aristaeus ended discourse king beholding cheereful pleasant countenance asked many thousand thought whose liberty required andrew hard hand answered one hundreth twentie thousand wherupon king replied demaund aristaeus matter small consequence thou requirest sosibius assistant answered reacknowledgement made vnto god giuen kingdome worthie greatnes courage reioycing content charged time deliuered men warre pay ouer aboue pay euery one prisoner sixe score drachmes touching request made promised dispatch letter pattents ample manner bring happie issue aristaeus suite rather satisfie god especially respected whereunto conforming himselfe sent proclamation king egypt proclamation touching liberty iewes sollicited aristaeus certifying thereby onely set libertie beene brought thither father army attended also time beene kingdome sithence likewise beene brought thither notwithstanding told money would required ransome would amount foure hundreth talent yet ceased confirme promised may plainely appeare great royal magnificence haue thought good insert place copie edict sent abroad effect whosoeuer father seruice bearing armes vnder haue made roades syria phaenicia conquest iudaea haue taken prisoner brought city country intent sell also haue heretofore man whereupon ptolomey embraced aboue rest made mount chariot sooner seated king began accuse onias committed ioseph said vnto pardon king haue respect old old yeeres know ordinarily old men yong child haue one vnderstanding yeare world 3770 christ birth 194 selues young shall haue please require without pretext cause discontent hereupon king tooke pleasure good behauiour pleasant discourse young man began loue receiued present attestation wisedome whereupon commaunded lodged owne pallace daily accompany princely table soone king came back alexandria lord syria seeing ioseph sitting neere vnto king sore displeased day drawing neere wherein receiue assurance tribute greatest reckoning countrey farmed tribute coelesyria phaenicia iudaea samaria amounted together eight thousand talent whereupon ioseph arising blamed farmer plotted amongst themselues beate downe price tribute promising giue double would likewise returne forfeiture leuied vpon good offended farmed together tribute king gaue eare discourse great content said tribute coelesyria cō mitted ioseph approoued sale tribute vnto ioseph sort augmented reuenue therefore demanded whether could giue surety made answere bold courage king said giue thee pledge worthy honourable cannot mistrust whenas therefore king instanted produce w •… said king present thee surety thy selfe queene thy wife one may suretie ptolomey smiling hereat granted farme tribute without suretie fauour displeased gouernours city come aegypt saw themselues contemned constrained returne shame vnto house ioseph obtained two thousand footman king end enforce tribute city negligent paiments borrowed fiue hundreth talent king friend alexandria hee departed syria soone came ascalon demaunded payment tribute citizen hand onely refused performe moreouer vpbraided iniurious word cause laying hold twentie principal among put death hauing gathered substance togither sent king thousand talent certifying done ptolomey admiring wisedome allowing execution permitted dispose thing pleasure syrian vnderstanding hereof sore abashed perceiuing acalonites slaine ascalonites scythopolitans punished contēpt ioseph thorow seueritie iustice disobedience opened gate receiued willingly payed tribute wheras also scythopolitanes way cōtumacy refused lay according order accustomed tribute slue chiefest amongst confiscation whose good sent vnto king therefore gathered much siluer made great gaines purchase tribute intent establish make power continuance liberally employed getting considering himselfe part wisedome keepe entertaine good happe rich himselfe gotten sent many present king queene bestowed liberall bountie familiar fauourites also authoritie credit fauour court win bind vnto beneuolence felicitie continued terme twentie daughter brought night vnto bed whereupon lay knowing reason drunke ouermuch company comming passe diuers time yet farre burningly inflamed loue dancer told brother daunger yeare world 3770 christ natiuitie 194 enamoured life time notwithstanding king would grant vnto brother told ought vexe himselfe promising assuredly enioie loued already wife opening vnto thing hapned rather wrong owne daughter suffer brother fall dishonour ioseph praised kind natural affection brother towards tooke daughter wife bare sonne called hircanus hath beene said thirteene yeares olde gaue testimonie naturall spirit dexteritie hyrcanus ofspring towardnes reason whereof brother conceiued certaine hatred rather excelled thing part might draw emulate whereas therefore ioseph desirous know child ripest iudgement vnderstanding sent one another master renowmed science time returned backe vnto rude illettered reason negligent idle whereupon sent hircanus youngest rest desart place distant high way seuen day iourney gaue three hundreth couple ox sow ground barren place hiding departure yoke couple together therefore came vnto place perceiued yoke missing asked aduise husbandman counsailed send one backe vnto father fetch couple supposing ought lose much time would spent sending backe messenger deuised cunning expedient stratageme might expected one yeares caused ten couple ox slaine distributed flesh amongst workemen made cut skin fashion couple thereof hauing yoked ox caused land manured according father direction afterwards returned home vnto loued intirely reason wisedom subtiltie vnderstanding praising besides resolution execution esteeming true sonne general discontent rest whenas therefore newes brought vnto ioseph time king ptolomey blessed young sonne chiefest lord syria country vnder obeisance repaired alexandria great pompe celebrate birth day king sonne himselfe vnable reason age repaire thither sounded child whether one would go visit king whenas therefore elder son excused themselues made refusall vndertake iourney pretending insufficient ability performe message gaue counsaile brother hircanus might sent ioseph tooke great pleasure thereat calling hircanus asked ioseph sendeth sonne hircanus ptolomey would goe king ptolomey promised vndertake iourney told father needed great summe money performe voyage way would trauell frugally content himselfe whole expence ten thousand drachmes ioseph verie glad heare son prudence hircanus kept silence counsailed father present king thing iudaea write vnto factor alexandria commaunding deliuer summes money thought conuenient buy found magnificent best esteeme citie ioseph imagining himselfe perhaps would onely employ tenne talent present allowing sonnes counsaile wrote vnto factor arion yeare world 3780 christ birth 184 treason intended hircanus vse almost three thousand talent alexandria gathering vp money syria wont send thither oft prefixed time came wherein king tribute paid commaunded arion defray hauing therefore letter credence vnto iourneyed towards alexandria wherupon brother wrote presently vnto king friend meanes would make away soone arriued alexandria deliuered coniecture father hath fleeced syria hath bared bone flesh king laughing hircanus iests triphons word asked hircanus came many bone without great cause said king dog deuoure flesh bone doe speech affaire liuing pleasure idlenes whereby grew great hatred amongst subiects haue alreadie declared another place demetrius knew alexander seazed ptolemais gathered force marched forth chap iiii pleasure like manner high priest shall take order iew adore temple ierusalem mine owne charge giue euery yeere hundreth fiftie thousand sicles siluer emploied making sacrifice shall ouer aboue antiochus found gazeans farre contrary disposition expected flatly resisted although intended forsake demetrius yet would ioine force submit citie gouernment cause ionathan besieged citie spoiled country one halfe army begirt gaza halfe ouerranne countrey spoyling burning gazeans seeing misery constrained endure perceiuing succour came vnto demetrius ouerthrow hand assistance farre worse vncertaine thought wisest part forsake one follow whereupon sent messenger vnto ionathan protesting would friend confederate men doe vnwillingly take knowledge profite haue bought sorrow neglected host sent demetrius came farre citie cedasa neere vnto tyre galilee making reckoning diuert ionathan syria succouring relieuing galilee confederate ionathan went speedily meete recommending estate iudaea charge brother simon assembling power possible gathered thorowout countrey encamped bethsura strong fort iudaea besieged demetrius time seazed thereof kept garrison therein haue declared vnto simon requesting would permit depart bethsura safety liues good go vnto demetrius satisfying demaunds presently departed citie planted garrison therein men place macedonian meane ionathan galilee publike affairers haue desired successe yeare world 3821 christ birth 143 haue desire selues good disposition much heretofore haue receiued letter hand demoteles written arius king onias high priest making mention acquaintance alliance betweene v copie whereof haue hereunder inserted haue receiued letter great content haue kindly acceptance requited demoteles arius notwithstanding ignorant consanguinitie long instructed therein sacred scripture whereas haue first acknowledged kinsman end feare rauish honor ratifying friendship betweene v intended alwaies since time wherein haue contracted friendship haue holy solemne day sacrificed vnto god beseeching continue keepe prosperitie side much haue beene inuironed many warres caused disordered desire neighbour haue neither thought meet troublesome vnto whatsoeuer time since haue obtained happie issue trouble haue sent numenius sonne antimachus antipater sonne iason men honourable amongst counsellers romanes also haue giuen letter presented vnto behalfe end might renue amitie betweene v shall therefore well write backe vnto v certifie v wherein may steed haue euer earnest desire wil cōtinue loue towards ought else concerneth welfare embassadours kindly entertained lacedemonians made publike ordinance touching association amitie iewes deliuered vnto time three sect among iewes different contrarie opinion touching humane affaire first pharisee second sadduces three sect iewes pharisee essenians sdaduces third essenians pharisee affirme thing thing directed destiny thing tied men election whether would performe essenians said destiny gouerned thing nothing hapned amongst men disposed thereby sadduces auow destinie humaine affaire destinie cannot gouerned disposed thereby onely opinion thing depend content himselfe onely piece great esteeme valew gaue beame inclosed hollow beame wood man knew thereof onely eleazar crassus therefore tooke beame determined leaue thing crassus breaketh oth whence temple ierusalem grew rich •… abo cappadocia temple yet notwithstanding falsified oath carried away whatsoeuer therein neither wondred great rich found temple since iewes dispersed thorow face whole earth feared god asia europe long time offered present place greatnesse multitude wherof wanteth testimony neither fained way ostentation diuers historian make mention thereof amongst rest strabo cappadocia speaketh manner mithridates sent men isle coo fetch thence money queene cleopatra laid vp eight hundreth talent iewes haue publike money dedicated vnto god therefore thing manifest iewes inhabite asia transported money coo feare mithridates likely inhabited iudaea citie strong temple well defenced send money coo neither credible likewise iewes remaining alexandria feared fal danger faelix assaileth phasaelus ierusalem ouercome vnder composition whereupon presently grieuously rebuked hircanus forgetfull diuers benefit receiued giuen aide vnto enemy malichus brother time reuolted planted garrison diuers fortress namely masada strongest soone herode therefore recouered health drew forth force dispossessed diuers place held suffered depart life good chap xxi herode discomfiteth antigonus sonne aristobulus driueth iudaea seeking recouer father kingdome aide prince tyre ptolomey mennaeus drew vnto force money aristobulus sonne young antigonus gathered power hired fabius likewise drawne ptolomey mē naeus adopteth antigonus aristobulus son ptolomey vnder title consanguinitie adoption ioyned marion cassius made gouernour tyre man hauing occupied syria tyrannie kept garrison therein marion also inuaded galilee confined countrey hauing seazed three strong fortress therein kept garrison herode also marching forth dispossessed al gratiously dismissed tyrians keeping herode expelleth antigonus iurie herode marrieth •… ā hircanus neece daughter doris herod wife thereof bestowing benefit loue bare vnto citie done came encountred antigonus fought ouercame scarcely notice certaine theeues robber inhabited caues sent troupe horsmen three company footman commanded doe iustice robber place kept farre burrough called arbela fortie day himselfe army resorted herode fighteth enemy galilee ouercommeth bringeth galilee vnder subiection thither whereas enemy issued hardy resolution left wing squadron retired fainted comming maine battell put flight already almost inhabited secretly family king herode caused certaine number cofers made fastned yron chaines caused let downe engine top mountaine neither possible reason steepinesse hill ascend beneath neither aboue creepe downward chest filled soldier armed great hooke draw theeues vnto breake neck headlong height bottome vse cofers dangerous necessarie let downe infinite depth caues especially theeues necessary munition among thē notwithstanding gotten downe none theeues durst peepe mouthes caues •… enre constrained hold themselues quiet certaine souldier hauing girt sword side taken hold chaine hand whereto cofer fastned •… de downē farre entrie caue displeased one issued shot diuers arrowes within wounded hooke drewe vnto resisted tumbled downe headlong steepy rocke done hēe rushed vpon within caue slew many them▪ afterwards returned rested himselfe cofer diuers hearing grones wounded surprised feare despaire life night approch cause matter fully atchieued many receiuing notice king free pardon herauld submitted themselues next day renued continued manner fight diuers issued cofers fight vpon outward entrance caues cast fire great quantitie wood caues quickly burne within caues certaine olde man apprehended wife seuen sonnes required certaine old man killeth wife seuen son last casteth himselfe headlong rocke would suster go submit themselues enemy tooke vp entrie caue sonnes aduaunced themselues issue slew vntill time inassacred wife finally cast dead body downe rockes threw himselfe downe headlong preferring death seruitude yet death reuiled herode bitter word vpbraided obscuritie ignoble race although herode saw happened stretched hand vnto promised pardon yet would respect meanes caues entered theeues therein taken king established ptolomey captaine ouer souldiers region retired himselfe samaria six hundreth horseman three thousand footman herode retireth toward samaria fight antigonus resolution fight antigonus end quarrel ptolomey slender successe auranita comprehended within caesar donation herode sum fiftie talent yeerely reuenue wherewith grew discontented vniustly depriued estate hereupon yeare world 3942 christ birth 22 made often incursion indeuouring themselues sometime recouer force otherwhile contending right possession course iustice drew also vnto certaine needy souldiers according custome wretched men expected better fortune change innouation though herode knew could haue prouidently preuented yet exhorted maintaine title rather good meanes open violence loth giue occasion new trouble disquiet length seuenteenth yeere raigne caesar came syria vpon whose arriuall diuers gadareans caesar commeth syria gadareans accule herode afterwards murther themselues began exclaime herode accusing seueritie tyrannie accusation rather attempted chiefely incited thereunto instigation false suggestion zenodorus bound himselfe oath would neuer giue ouer vntill deliuering herodes tyrannie reduced vnder caesar protection gadareans perswaded protestation began continue exclamation audaciously perceiued liued yet vnpunished agrippa deliuered herodes hand herode set libertie without punishment standing regard owne subiects inexorable euer man patient induring iniuries offered stranger yeare world 3946 christ natiuitie 18 alwaies dismissed without reuenge therefore accused violence rapine violating racing downe temple herode nothing dismaied thereat presented himselfe emperour iustifie action caesar entertained verie kindly diminished nothing good affection bare vnto notwithstanding vprores insolent tumult people thus first day spent audience complaint day followed obiections heard gadareans perceiuing caesar disposition inclination counsaile fearing likely deliuered herodes hand next night slew themselues feare torment brake owne neck also drowned themselues riuer thus whereas seemed foreiudge themselues caesar presently absolued herode felicitie seconded small consequence zenodorus vlatha paneaas region giuen herod herode highly esteemed caesar agrippa caesar maketh pheroras tetrarth hauing bowel broken extreame flux bloud finished life antioch syria whereupon caesar gaue herode conference great desire aske certaine thing concerning customes countrey obtained hauing got neere certified interpreter followeth young man said sodaine change hath befallen thee present afflicteth oppresseth thee great grieuous torment neither wilt thou easily beleeue thou shalt escape thy miserie yet doth diuine prouidence dispose thing thou shalt shortly deliuered know therefore sweare vnto thee god mine auncestors certaine germane foretelleth agrippa happie fortune come manner death also haue residence presidence place haue procured v yron chaine tell thee yeeld thee pleasure vaine discourse entertaine thee fruitlesse consolation knowing well prediction shall happen faile breede thee sorrow thou hadst neuer heard speech haue thought good yea although mine owne danger declare vnto thee prediction god cannot otherwaies shortly thou shalt deliuered bond shalt aduanced great honour power day haue compassion thy calamitie shal beare enuie thy glorie thou shalt depart life doe thee wrong conceale prediction thee hauing foreknowledge thereof haue therefore thought good impart ioy vnto thee wherby thorow hope thy future profit thou maiest easily indure thy present senats hand incouraged incited take vpon gouernment empire men warre offered done departed sodainly sent senate whither resorted altogither perfumed odor time returned banquet knowen nothing hapned therefore asked senator become claudius certified truth besides required giue opinion counsaile touching present affaire aunswere readie aduenture life behalfe senate yet way told ought haue especiall regard commonweale rather pleasure could pretend would lord empire need armes men maintaine themselues least weake vnfurnished deceiued expectation senate replied great store furniture would contribute money good store men warre would annexe slaues giue liberty agrippa replied would god agrippa telleth senat opinion graue father able performe matter intend yet feare discouer vnto concerneth neerely know well army claudius consisteth men haue beene long time trained vp feat armes fight side men gathered togither couple scumme slaues intractable vntrained shall therefore enter fight expert souldiers commit fortune men scarcely know draw sword rather thinke meete send vnto claudius men may perswade giue ouer empire performe message behold selfe readines commaunded effect spake agrippa hereunto senator accorded sent claudius appointing certaine others accompany agrippa sent claudius claudius aunswere embassador soone came claudius secretly discouered vnto perplexitie senat gaue instruction answere demean himselfe like emperour shew dignitie power whereupon claudius gaue embassador answere wondered senat vnwilling commanded soueraign regard cruelty forepassed emperor vsed destruction present taste mercy feele moderate rule liue vnder gouernment one although name imperiall authoritie yet effect would gouerne thing disposition cause wished sort distrust themselues could witnes haue seene knowen haue dealt vertuously iustly many affaire although state time beene farre different sent senate hearing word returned backe againe claudius souldiers oath noyse cut proceeding earnestly affected haue emperour soueraign lord required expedition might haue one proclaimed knowne time senate distracted maner command meanes ought vse cause themselues obeied considerng souldiers set light confederate death caius suffered senate obey souldiers length chaereas vnable conceale passiō wherwith surprised hearing asked monarch promised would giue thē one would bring token eutychus wagoner greene band caius loued extremely somuch employed souldiers seruile labour build stable horse reproched thē diuers like matter telling thē would bring claudius head shewing matter ill beseeming mad man commend empire foole yet none word could diuert purpose drew sword displaied ensignes marched towards claudius vnite themselues alreadie bound themselues oath serue faithfully senat abādoned destitute defence difference betwixt priuate souldier •… displaied ensign •… repaire claudius sabinus rather choseth death allow claudius men consul astonished confused knowing thus prouoked claudius displeasure fell reuiling one another testimonie repentance conceiued proceeding wherupon sabinus one murthered caius arose protested would sooner cut throat
