wholy afterwards preparing armor fortifying city calling stoutest sosephsendeth backe companion ierusalem ioseph president galilee theeues perceiued might recouer vveapons perswaded multitude hire reward telling profitable entertaine seruice suffer countrey spoiled excursion thus hauing taken oathes dismisse thē vnder condition come region except called receiue due pay vnder condition abstaine spoiling either roman inhabitant countrey aboue thing care keepe galilee peace whereas desire get seuentie pledge loyaltie chosen amongst nobilitie vnder pretext friendship soone came vnto way frienship made companion fellow iudges decreed many thing according opinion hauing especiall care least thorow rashnes ioseph ioyned seuentie nobilitie ioseph thirtie yeeres age offered woman violence would bribed iniurie iustice thorow corruption reward distaine mine incorrupted honour time therefore thirtie yeeres olde yeeres although man bridle himselfe vnlawfull affection yet hardly escape poisoned sting detraction especially great authoritie annexed greene yeeres neuer offered vaine vnlawfull courting vvoman neither could man fasten bribe pretended want nothing yea refused tenth right priesthood might haue receiued brought yet conquest syrian tooke part spoile freely confesse sent ierusalem kinsman whereas two time forcibly ouercome sephorites tiberians foure time gadarenians brought iohn vnder subiection oftentimes sought entrap neither could iosephs bountie towards enemy endure reuenge selfe neither aboue named people sequel storie make manifest cause suppose god trier searcher iust heart deliuered time hand mine enemy afterwards many time daungerous seuerall misfortune hereafter shall appeare time place galilean faith loue towards ioseph great faith beneuolence common people galilee towards city ouerthrowne family led captiuitie spent many teares owne calamity bestowed care perseruation securitie iohn perceiued began enuie besought letter would giue iohn desireth might bath himselfe hotte b •… thes tiberias licence health sake bath himselfe hot bathe tiberias suspecting treason willingly granted demaunded moreouer wrote vnto •… committed trust administration citie prepare lodging furnish companion victual prouide also thing necessarie diet entertainement meanespace selfe past time certaine village galilee called cana iohn came tiberias wrought townsman sort forgetting faith dutie reuolted vnto many lent willing iohns treason eare vnto intreaties especially reioycing innouations prone chaunge greedie dissension espec •… iustus father pistus willingly entertained occasion reuolt obedience submit themselues iohn yet conspiracy preuented speedie accesse certaine messenger came vnto silas former time preferred gouernment tiberias certified citizen intent exhorted haste make repaire thither otherwise citie would shortly fall another man hand soone therefore perused silas letter trauailed night long two hundreth chosen men sending messenger might signifie approch citizen lost neither time way morning drue neere vnto citie whole people came meet people tiberias came meete ioseph among rest iohn beheld saluted suspicious countenance fearing least treason discouered grow daunger life speedily retired himselfe lodging drew neere citie within furlong dismissing iosephs exhortation tiberians guard one retaining onely tenne armed souldiers began expostulate tiberians certaine high place whence might heard counsailed reuolt least might shortly repent mutabilitie breach faith man hereafter would giue credit alreadie either suspected guiltie perfidiousnes scarcely spoken heard one attendant perswaded descend telling time reconcile iohn seeketh betroy murther ioseph tiberians perswade rather seeke mine owne securitie might escape mine enemy iohn learnt destitute follower sent thousand chosen souldiers commaunding kill hand readie commit murther speedily lept downe seruant iacob relieued herode tiberian beene brought lake finding barke chance putting forth sea escaped contrarie mine enemy expectation came taricheas soone inhabitant citie vnderstood perfidiously traiterously tiberians dealt sore displeased betaking themselues weapon galilean require •… inuade tiberias perswaded lead forth telling would reuenge iniurie offered vnto gouernour blased treason thorow galilee vvhich cause number armed galilean came vnto requesting would inuade tiberias entering would spoyle ruines thereof would sell inhabitant whole family vnder speare like friend escaped vvith citie perswade sort would admit suit supposing bee matter vnworthy discretion reuiue cause ciuill warre imagining selfe contention ought proceed word yea protested vnto reuenge vvould preiudiciall themselues also roman standing gaze spend themselues ciuill discord meanes length galilean wrath appeased iohn perceiued failed purpose began feare cause taking armed men kept forsaking tiberias repaired iohn excuseth himselfe ioseph gischala thence wrote letter vnto excusing fact beene way guiltie thereof besought would sort suspect confirmed word execrable othes whereby might winne credit writing galilean vvere gathered great multitude part region knowing vvas wicked perfidious man besought would lead forth promising ouerthrow gischala countrey therefore giuen thanks loue towards promised mine office loue answerable kindnes yet besought restraine themselues grant pardon thought better appease procure trouble request mine galilean granted whereupon presently came sephoris townsman vvere resolued continue faithfull towards romane people fearing approch indeuoured themselues distract affaire whereby might liue securitie whereupon sending messenger iesus captaine theeues kept vpon confines ptolemais promised great summe money army eight hundreth men iesus captaine theeues liued vnder commaund vvould wage warre v hee allured promise bethought himselfe assaile v sodainly vnawares cause besought messenger would grant leaue libertie come salute obtained wholy ignorant treason taking troupe theeues hasted speedily towards yet failed purposed treason farre certaine fugitiue troupe discouered intent towards heard went market place faining knew nothing secret fraud attended multitude armed galilean among certaine tiberians afterwards sending abroad certain spy scoure high way commanded keeper iesus seeketh betray ioseph gate onely suffer iesus enter formost company exclude rest attempt break force beat fulfilling commaunded iesus entered commanded presently lay downe weapon except desired slaine seeing himselfe inuironed armed souldiers obeyed whereupon followed excluded perceiuing iosephpolitickly surpriseth iesus captaine apprehended sodainly betooke flight leading iesus apart tolde ignorant treason intended neither whose prouocation attempted yet told would pardon changing manner would faithfull vnto hereafter promising iosephs bountie towards iesus requested dismissed man gaue leaue depart weapon yet threatned punish sephorites except hereafter desisted treason time came two noble men vnto subiect king trachonitis bringing horseman armour money iewes would haue constrained circumcised would remaine amongst would permit troublesome trachonites alleadging euerie man ought according owne minde men impulsion serue god suffered iosephs care religion securitie sake fled vnto v repent themselues trust put v thus hauing perswaded multitude freely aboundantly furnished men thing necessarie meane space agrippa sent force vnder conduct equus modius take castle magdala force durst assault beset way rather troubled gamala ebutius decadarchus gouernment great champion ebutius ioseph hearing come certaine village called simonias scituate vpon confines galilee distant sixtie furlong tooke night one hundreth horse attended two hundreth footman certaine inhabitant citie gaba associate conducted night assailed beset burrough drawne foorth valiant band men ebutius laboured length perceiuing vse horseman place sounded retreat departed backe againe lost labour gaba hauing onely lost three men battell ebutius departeth without performing thing presently pursued two thousand armed men came belara scituate confines ptolemais distant 20 furlong frō gaba ebutius encāped time besetting passage court guard whereby might secure excursion enemy vntill carried wheate whereof great quantitie stored vp place gathered township therabout belonging queene berenice loading diuers camel ass ende brought sent corne galilee hauing finished businesse offered ioseph transporteth corne galilee ioseph neopolitanus ebutius battell whereas detracted terrified boldnesse tooke course encounter neopolitanus reported territorie tiberians foraged neopolitanus captaine horseman vndertaken defend scythopolis enemy hauing therefore driuen wrong countrey belonging tiberians prouided securitie galilee iohn sonne leui said liued gischala heard thing sell iohn maligneth iosephs good successe fortunately loued subiects feared mine enemy fore aggrieued thereat supposing owne fortune embased felicitie touched small enuie greater hope hinder good successe could bring hatred subiects sollicited tiberias sephoris forsake supposed also gabarenians would reuolt vnto city chiefest galilee told vnder conduct common weale gabarenians reuolt vpon iohns perswasion discreetly gouerned among rest sephorites gaue least eare vnto neglecting v onely held roman tiberians would consent rebell yet notwithstanding promised friendship gabarenians wholy addicted themselues vnto iohn meanes one simon principall citizen iohns fellow friend yet openly seeme allow vehemently feared galilean whose good towards long time assured priuily sought another meanes entrap truely fell great danger vpon occasion certaine dabarittenians audacious young men intelligence dabarittenians spoile ptolomies wifet ptolomeis wife king steward vnder conduct certaine horsmen great pompe trauell along great plaine king countrey roman gouernment sodainly set vpon putting woman flight spoiled shee carried done droue taricheas place kept certaine moyles loaden apparell houshold stuffe diuers sort among diuers siluer vessel fiue hundreth piece gold intending therefore reserue thing ptolomey one tribe lawe permitteth defraud enemy tribe told brought good thither must kept solde end price good might bestowed vpon building wals ierusalem motion mine young men interpreted verie hardly cut part pray hoped cause dispersing themselues streetes tiberias spred rumour would betray country roman alleadging onely fained pray destinated toward repairing walles ierusalem whereas truth kept intent might restore owner matter whit deceiued opinion departure young men called vnto two chiefe citizen dassion iannaeus soones leui intire friend king commaunded taking houshold stuffe ioseph laboureth restore ptolomey good conuay vnto king threatning death reuealed secret vnto man rumour spred thorow galilee would betray region hand roman grieuously bent intent punish taricheas also giuing credit young men fained speech perswaded guard rest souldiers forsaking whilest asleepe come horse race consult place degrade giue honour vnto another perswaded came appointed place found many others arriued cried one consent meete take punishment traytor hath sought destruction common weale incited trouble iesus sonne saphias time magistracie tiberias hand man giuen ouer wickednesse borne breed trouble sedition ioseph iesus son saphias conspireth ioseph stirre vp sedition man bearing moses table hand comming midst assembly spake thus loud voice said touched care selues yet leastwise contemne sacred lawes chiefetaine ioseph man worthy hated men hath long time dared betray cause worthy extreame punishment spoken thus applauded acclamation people leading armed men hastily repaired house kept certaine intent simon one iosephs guard awaketh purpose put death meane suspecting nothing tumult tired labour wearinesse tooke rest sodainly simon one guard time remained seeing incursion people came awaked certifying mine instant perill gaue counsell likewise rather like noble vndaunted chieftaine shorten mine owne life shamefully die mine enemy direction whilest gaue counsell committing safetie god hand changing ioseph moueth people compassion garment went foorth assembly mournfull manner wearing sword hanging necke stealing way knew none mine aduersaries might meete comming horse race offered selfe euerie man eie lying prostrate face watring earth teares mooued al men beheld compassion perceiued affection people changed laboured might deuide opinion armed soldier returned house confessing selfe wholy cleere obiected besought vnderstand vse reserued pray brought vnto hand list might kill whilest multitude commaunded speake armed men returned backe beholding rushed vpon intent murther restrained people exclamation moderated furie supposing confession treason reseruation king money might haue better occasion finish tragedy cause silence began thus men brother said opinion deserue death refuse die yet death certifie whole truth truly iosephs oration confession aduersaries perceiued citie commodious fit entertaine stranger perceiued many men forsaking owne country delighted conuersations willing partake sort fortune resolued build vp wals money thus destinated doe good indignation prouoked vpon word taricheans stranger cried giuing thankes willing good courage galilean tiberians continued hatred insomuch grew debate betwixt themselues one threatning punishment contrariwise willing assure selfe securitie promised ioseph escapeth daunger tiberians would reedifie wals fortifie conuenient city giuing credit word repaired euerie one owne house beyond expectation escaping great perill certaine friend twentie souldiers returned house againe theeues author sedition fearing least punished offence begirt lodging six hundreth armed men intending consume ioseph daunger fire whose arriuall soone intelligence imagining selfe would much dishonour flie resolued vse valour courage cause commanding gate shut required top house would send vnto receiue money drawn iosephs stratageme mutinie whereby might haue cause incensed done laying hold one troublesome fellowes rest came vnto caused beaten many grieuous stroke hand cut hung necke thus handled thrust doores returne vnto sent wondrously affraid herewith suspecting like punishment stay longer suspected diuers armed souldiers house sodainly fled away stratageme escaped danger yet wanted incited people saying king seruants fled vnto refuge ought liue except submitted themselues lawes customes required protection likewise accused roman faction poisoner presently people began mutinie another sedition deceiued word laboured flatter heard enformed people ought persecute resorted vnto rescous iested folly accused impoisoning roman would vainly nourish many thousand souldiers pretended make away enemy poison word somewhat pacified scarcely withdrawn themselues awhile certaine outcast wicked men incited nobilitie armed weapon resorted house taricheans intending murther heard sore affraid wickednesse committed man hereafter dare trust life hand cause assisted diuers others hastily resorted lodging shut vp gate cutting trench ioseph priuately dismisseth taricheans betwixt lake called barke entring crossed ouer confines hippenians furnishing money buy horse could transport owne flight dismissed requiring digest present misfortune constant minde selfe tooke verie heauily inforced land men enemy countrey committed themselues trust yet thinking fall fal roman hand safer suffering remaine countrey see opprest aduentured thus yet saued king gaue pardon end tumult tiberias wrote vnto king requiring send garrison country promising reuolt follow done soone came vnto required would build wals promised alreadie heard taricheas inuironed wals whereunto condescended gathering stuffe euerie place set workemen taske three day departing tiberians letter agrippa seuen stadium make almost germaine mile sedition rebellion tiberias tiberias towards taricheas thirtie stades distant thence chance troupe roman horseman discouered farre citie made inhabitant beleeue king army whereupon presently began vtter many thing honour king reproch presently certaine friend posted vnto told minde intended reuolt vnderstood wondrously troubled sent backe men warre taricheas house next day sabboth day would mean citizen tarichea charged troubled entertaining souldiers time remained citie tooke care guard mine owne person hauing often proofe loyaltie inhabitant towards therefore time attended onely seuen souldiers friend knew thought fit call backe force day welny past although haue ioseph danger tiberians take beene next morning yet might haue taken armes lawes forbad great soeuer occasion offered although haue drawen forth taricheans stranger retired thither vnder hope pray led forth yet saw feeble resist force side alreadie perceiued staied ouer long armie sent king alreadie entered citie would haue excluded therfore determined vse stratagem presently therfore garded gate taricheans trustie friend suffering man passe assembling chiefest euerie family commaunded euery one lanch boat lake follow master ship friend seuen souldiers betooke v barke sailed toward tiberias tiberians perceiued force come king whole lake couered barkes amazed fearing ruine citie supposed ioseph saileth tiberias ship loaden souldiers chaunged former opinion cause laying weapon themselues wiues child came forth meete entertaining happie acclamation thought heard inkling intent beseeching safetie citie would enter drawing neere citie commanded master barkes cast anchor farre shore least townsman might perceiue ship emptie selfe drawing neere mine owne barke vnto accused contrarie oathes beene foolishly induced reuolt afterwards promised assured pardon would deliuer tenne chiefest nobilitie incontinently performed shipt bark sent prisoner taricheas pollicie one another last got senate tiberias many chiefest citizen carried thither also length rest multitude soone perceiued great daunger besought would punish chiefe author conspiracie clytus author sedition tiberias called clytus bould rash young man held wicked act kill one tribe yet inforced punish commaunded leuias one guard go vnto cut hand daring alone enter huge multitude feare least cowardise discouered tiberians called clytus vnto said vnto since said vngratefull perfidious man thou art thou deseruest lose thy hand charge thee become thine owne executioner feare least thorow thy delay clytus cutteth owne left hand thou procure thy punishment whereas many praiers besought grant one hand hardly condescended length owne accord feare least hee lose hee tooke knife cut left hand thus tumult appeased soone returned taricheas tiberians vnderstood stratageme vsed amazed seeing punished ingratitude disobedience without bloudshed murther sent people tiberias prison amongst iustus father pistus inuited sup mee repast told ignorant romane army excelled men world power force notwithstanding kept selfe silent respect theeues round counsailed also would doe like expectation better day yet meane time would thinke amisse gouernment time afforded affable commodious gouernour admonished iustus also came ierusalem galilean cut brother hand accusing haue forged false letter warre philip departure gamalites od babylonian slue chares philip kinsman ioseph dismisseth tiberians moderately punished brother law iesus maried sister discourse supper time dismissed iustus friend earely morning freedomes came passe hapned philip sonne iacimus departed fort philip son iacimus gamala vpon occasion ensueth soone vnderstood varus reuolted king agrippa modius equus friend sent succeed hee certified estate letter receiued highly reioyced philip safetie sent letter king queene liued berytum whereupon king vnderstanding false rumour ranne touching philip chieftaine iewes armie vndertook warre romanes sent certaine horseman philip bring presence sooner arriued embraced kindly shewed romane captain telling philip agrippa kindnes humanitie toward philip hedio gadara commonly reported rebellion romanes therefore charged taking certaine horseman post al diligence fort gamala drawing household seruants thence lead reestablish babylonian batanaea trauaile vttermost power subiect continued obedience peace philip receiued commaundement daily towards greatly agrieued see fortune happy successe answerable whereas hee wholy resolued rid life encompassed country gischala wals sendeth simon brother one hundreth souldiers ierusalem simon sonne gamaliel requiring labour matter sort citie authoritie might disanulled iohn common consent might ordained gouernour ouer affaire galilee simon borne ierusalem noble birth sect pharisee iohn laboureth supply ioseph gouernment sect seemed exactly instructed lawes countrey man excellent wisedome counsaile able repaire decaying ruines countrey long time made vse iohns friendship time mine enemie man solicited intercession friend perswaded hie priest ananus iesus sonne gamala line faction cut increasing honour simone counsaile ioseph permit attaine fulnes content thereof verie profitable also remoued gouernment galilee told ananus rest delay matter least vpon discouerie counsaile inuade citie mine army thus spake simon yet ananus high priest replied might easily done diuers priest gouernours people bare witnesse behaued selfe honestly gouernment ill done intend accusation man might touched misdemeanour simon heard ananus said besought rest also speake nothing thereof neither make motion knowen certifying prouidently prouided speedily driuen galilee calling vnto brother iohn charged send present ananus said would much worke would make change opinion end simon obtained long time sought ananus adherent corrupted money accorded cast gouernment galilee without consent allowance citizen cause thought good send certaine noble men birth way inferiour simon second counsaile ioseph one another learning whereof two common sort pharises one called ionathas ananias third iozarus tribe leui also pharisee race priest simon order priest yongest commaund calling togither councell galilean demaund loued well commanding answered galilean likewise say ierusalem countrey allowed knowledge law likewise willed say knew country customes embassadours souldiers sent ioseph regard name priesthood say loued likewise auerre two priest thus instructed receiuing fortie thousand siluer drachmes publike treasure fellow consort ionathas sette forwardes verie time certaine man called iesus galilee come ierusalem band six hundreth souldiers sent hired gaue three moneths pay commanding follow ionathas companion doe commaund annexed three hundreth citizen hired reward preparation legate set forward accompanied simon iohns brother one hundreth souldiers commission sent willingly gaue ouer armes send aliue ierusalem resisted authoritie might lawfully kill letter also directed iohn incited make warre moreouer charged sephorites gabarites tiberians maintaine iohn intelligence hereof iosephs father signifieth newes vnto father letter intelligence thereof iesus sonne gamala one present deliberation intirely familiarly loued much grieued seeing much ingratitude countrimen required malice decreed vpon death father inuited affectionate letter draw selfe homeward telling much desired see sonne left life imparted thing friend certified within three day would forsake countrey ioseph resolueth return home retire selfe mine owne whereupon altogither surprised great sadnesse besought mee weeping teares would forsake vtterly ouerthrowne left destitute conduct whereas meanes might perswade care mine owne securitie preuailed verie much galilean fearing least leaue meanes theeues encouraged set vpon sent messenger thorow galilee signifie vnto resolution departure whereupon diuers made priuie newes resorted vnto part bringing wiues child much suppose sorrow conceiued departure feare owne estate perswaded themselues remained among could mischiefe befall assembled therefore great plaine called aso •… remained night sleepe wonderfull dreame lying bed wholy iosephs admirable dreame disconsolate troubled newes receiued thought certaine man aboue spake vnto manner pacifie thou passion thy spirit thou free feare discomforteth thee shall shall make thee great happy beyond thine expectation onely thing shall turne fortunate ende issue also many thou therefore dismaide remember thy selfe thou art reserued make warre romansafter dreame awaked prepared w •… nt downe plaine soone came thither people galilee wiues child humbling themselues vpon earth weeping besought would leaue pray enemy neither would abandon countrey number galilean besought ioseph would forsake serue pray mockerie aduersaries seeing made small reckoning praiers constrained oath remaine amongst vttered diuers iniurious outrage people ierusalem enuied peace happines enioyed heard word seene desolation people heart broken compassion resolued selfe respect great multitude life could better hazarded contentment therefore gaue consent remaine gaue order fiue thousand best souldiers prouision attend ioseph consenteth stay galilee rest sent backe euerie owne owne house fiue thousand presented themselues annexed three thousand drew fourescore horseman marched towards chabalon burrough vpon march ptolemais vndertooke prepare battell expecting assault placidus come two company footman one horseman sent placidus ioseph cestius gallus burne countrey townes galilee little burroughs bordered ptolemais entrenched citie ptolemais encamped mine army likewise farre burrough chabalon sixtie stades diuers time drew force bid battell neuer would offer thing skirmish placidus perceiuing forwardnesse fight abashed thereat retired himselfe yet departed ptolemais time came ionathan embassadours haue heretofore declared sent simon high priest ananus laboured entrap policie durst assaile open field therefore wrote letter vnto ionathans letter ioseph effect ionathan embassadours sent ierusalem ioseph greeting certified chiefest men ierusalem iohn gischala hath oftentimes sought betray cause sent represse malice exhort hereafter submit himselfe vnto desirous conferre touching concerneth publike profit pray resort vnto v soone attendant burrough able entertain many effect wrote vnto horseman brought letter hoping one two effect would fal either comming disarmed easily surprised bringing great companie condemned enemy countrey messenger brought letter valiant young man mounted horsebacke time past borne armes king time wherein came vnto two houres within night euen banquetting friend chiefest goue •… nours galilee one houshold seruants certified certaine iew horsebacke came speake commanded brought embracing coldly deliuering letter said vnto come frō ierusalem send letter giue speedy answere commanded make speedy returne sate table amazed souldiers boldnesse selfe willed sit downe make merrie refusing kept letter hand manner receiued began iosephs pollicy talke friend affaire long arising supper dismissing rest rest onely retained inward friend commanding page fill wine opened letter man perceiued conceiting incontinently meant sealed anew knowne nothing content hauing letter hand gaue order soldier receiue twenty drachmes beare charge voiage hauing receiued giuing thankes perceiued well addicted gaine might easily wrought money wherupon said vnto thou wilt drinke thou shalt haue drachme euerie glasse thou drinkest souldier listned willingly hauing dranke good store wine get greater store money grew drunken vnable longer conceale secret owne accord declared treason prepared sentence death giuen vnderstood answered effect ioseph ionathan accompanie health verie glad iosephs answer ionathan heare arriued galilee good health especially may redeliuer hand gouernment affaire thereof end according haue long time desired might returne countrey onely therefore visit xallon anie place also notwithstanding neuer sent notwithstanding pardon though come present chabalon confront placidus pretendeth inuade galilee resort therefore vnto mee vvho shall reade letter farewell written answere deliuered souldier carrie vnto sent way thirtie approoued friend galilee commanding salute ionathans message letter ioseph come without anie speech assigned also one resolute best souldiers take heede least sent conferre ionathans men therefore set forward way ionathan seeing first purpose failed sent another letter tenour ensueth ionathan companie ioseph health commaund within three day make appearance v without anie souldiers burrough gadara end maie answere iohn hath obiected soone written saluted sent went iapha greatest towne galilee defenced strong walles peopled manie inhabitant people citie wiues child came forth exclaiming huge cry charging embassador ierusalem coldly entertained galilee returne backe depriue good gouernour ionathan companion prouoked cry yet durst make anie open shew displeasure without returning answere resorted city met lesse effectuall exclaimes multitude protesting loud voice man able disswade continuing ioseph authoritie gouernment whereupon ionathan follower marched forth without speech came sephoris greatest citie galilee inhabitant thereof addicted roman came foorth part neither praised blamed departing sephoris came asochim citizen sung song iapheans whereupon vnable containe displeasure commanded souldiers beate truncheon exclaimed claimed gouernour drew neere gabara iohn came meete accompanied three thousand souldiers hauing intelligence letter resolued make warre departed chabalon accompanied three thousand souldiers hauing committed campe charge trustiest friend went iotapata would within foure stades sent letter must needly come vnto galilee two hundreth foure city burroughs ioseph writeth againe thē meete anie one please except gabara gischala one place iohns natiuitie associate friend soone ionathan receiued answere replied sought mean entrap iohn opinion write vnto city burroughs galilee supposing consultation embassador ioseph without question one two mine enimies might incense •… common enimie gaue order also resolution sent ierusalem end citie vnderstanding adiudged enimie galilean might like sort confirme decree opinion said meanes would come passe galilean well affected towards forsake feare aduice iohns meruailosly pleased presently brought vnto third houre night one •… cchaeus flying came brought newes particularly related intent cause perceiuing time req •… ed longe •… delaie supposing iacob one assured •… rustiest seruants commanded take two hundreth men belay way olle champion countrey encampe amidst field contenting themselues prouision brought tolde generall would exting •… trouble without effusion bloud hapned day ionathans messenger letter fell hand guard passage appointment according direction men kept securitie gaue order finding letter brought full nothing slaunders lie written embassadours said word man thought best pollicie set vpon ionathans saue one expecting come way salute word commanded souldiers enter suffer man else enter exclude rest made account meanes might easily lay hold deceiued hope hauing notice hand intent soone came thither entering lodging right ouer fained went take rest whereupon ionathans souldiers supposing asleep troth safe came forth haste plaine labouring disswade souldiers loue alleagiance detracting gouernment thing fell contrarie thought soone discouered galilean gaue great shout testifying good bare vnto gouernour blamed embassadours without cause iniury come disturbe publike peace willing gone intended admit gouernour thing signified vnto made doubt aduenture selfe among cause speedily went heare embassadours could alledge vpon arriuall ioseph presenteth himselfe among enemy whole troupe shouted ioy applauded loud voice giuing thanks happie peaceable gouernment ionathan adherent hearing afraid least galilean set vpon grow daunger life began bethinke themselues might escape perceiuing delaid performe spying one souldiers stood better apparelled wont good taken citizen restored asked gotten garment confessing taken spoile citie chasticed stroke threatned worser punishment would restore taken away whereby recouering great part pray togither gaue euery citizen knew owne place cannot chuse sort must reprehend iustus wrote vpon argument others promising historie afraid contempt truth either fauour reproofe iustus historiographer fal •… ely accused ioseph hatred commit lie posteritie differ nothing counterfaiters euidences racer record men corrupted impunitie end might seeme imploy time well vndertaking set downe euents warre hath belied many thing hath beene ashamed belie owne countrey cause necessarily inforced place discouer hitherto haue concealed reproue hath falsely testified neither wondered haue long time deferred performance therof whosoeuer writeth historie ought necessitie speake truth yet lawfull inueigh wickedder sort vehemently worthie fauour owne modesty sake tell therefore iustus thou desirest held man greatest note amongst historian art ashamed vaunt boast thy selfe title tell pray thee familiaritie must talke thee thou wert present galilean haue beene author rebellion thy countrey began roman king chosen gouernor galilee people ierusalem thou tiberians onely vp armes alreadie made warre ten city syria thy selfe hadst burnt village one thy seruants died encountrie yet alone protest extant also writing record emperour vespasian inhabitant tenne city cried vespasian citie ptolemais requiring thou mightst punished author mischiefes assuredly thou hadst beene punished emperour agrippa receiued commission execute thee vpon instant request sister berenice spared thee life kept thee bound prison long time furthermore thy politicke behauiours sufficiently expresse rest thy life hath beene thou hast caused thy countrey rebell romanes whereof produce hereafter euident argument thy cause vrge somewhat tiberians make plaine shal faith romanes thrust doores forbidding euery man among beare armes iewes end might assured behalfe inhabitant deceiued intreated incompasse citie wall done willingly entertained garrison sent cestius gallus generall romane legion syria contempt although time great power terrified countrey round abouts great citie ierusalem besieged temple common nation daunger fall enemy hand sephorites sent round might haue verie easily kept faith roman listed citie people furnished munition aboundance thou saist cause time afterwards thou knowest siege ierusalē roman hand iotapata taken force diuers castle many galilean spent diuers battels time shouldest thou haue deliuered thy self feare thou hadst laying thine armes aside presenting thy selfe king roman thou vndertookest armes thine accord inforced truth expected vespasian comming euen vntil time begirt citie wals siege laid armes aside feare danger yea euen thē citie bin ouerthrown except king excuse folly obtained pardon vespasian hand therefore fault offence behaued selues like enemy remember often time haue obtained victorie time could complaine bloudshed falling dissension one another haue beene instrument owne ruine loue bare either king romanes owne malice slewe one hundreth eightie fiue citizen time besieged romanes iotapata nay true siege ierusalem whereof haue made mention two thousand tiberians slaine otherwise taken prisoner perhaps thou wilt alledge time thou wert enemie thou wert fled king tell thee thou fleddest thither feare thou hadst wicked man thou saist art thou king agrippa vpon many present deliuered punishment time thou wert condemned vespasian lose thy head cause hauing made thee prisoner twice hauing iustus condemned death many time past sentence banishment thee hauing commanded thee thine owne murtherer hath giuen thee life vpon importunate sollicitation sister bernice many crime cōmitted thee hauing entertained thee secretary found thy corruption office banished thee presence exactly touch thee matter yet notwithstanding wonder thine impudence hast openly protested thou hast written exactly perfectly matter man whereas thou art vtterly ignorant thing done galilee time wert thou berytum king wer •… way priuie iustus knew nothing wa •… e iewes siege iotapata seeing thou didst follow v neither couldst thou able learne behaued selfe therin one left aliue giue thee certain intelligence thou wilt perhaps say thou hast carefully described hapned siege ierusalem▪ may possible thou wert neither agent looker warre neither hast thou red commentary vespasian coniecture hereby thou hast read forasmuch thou hast written cleane contrary contained therein thou art confident thy historie truer men didst thou publish vespasian titus liues general warre neither king agrippa rate expert greek tongue thou hast kept written thee aboue twentie yeeres mightst haue produced witnes iustus published booke titus vespasian dead thine exact diligence priuie thing dead thou thinkest man liueth may reproue thee thou hast vndertaken boldnes publish thy work haue vsed pollicy feare bookes haue presented emperours themselues haue beene eie witness actor thereof knew mine owne soule set downe thing truely whereupon obtained expected approbation moreouer communicated historie diuers others whereof present warre king agrippa kinred titus emperour himselfe desirous men search truth historie bookes placed librarie caused published manifest testimony truth iosephus historie first epistle second epistle subscribed owne hand king agrippa sent seuentie two epistle testifying truth bookes whereof two vnderwritten end truth may appeare thereby king agrippa deere friend ioseph health haue great contentment ouerred thy booke wherein thou seemest opinion haue handled matter exactly cause pray thee send rest fare well deere friend king agrippa ioseph deere friend health perceiue thine owne writing thou needest intelligence matter haue passed beginning yet wee meet next betweene thee certifie thee certaine thing thou knowest thus witnesse truth accomplished historie flattering became iosephus prosecuteth historie leaueth debate iustus neither deriding perhaps may obiect farre noble minde subiect seruile folly end truth writing might commended reader worth testimonie thus much haue thought good set downe way answere iustus soone pacified trouble tiberias established councell well affected towards bethought selfe concerned doe respect iohn galilee opinion arme battell array march iohn doe iustice vpon beene author mischiefe mine owne part misliked counsel desire twentie day determine seemed best owne securitie threatned set fire foure thousand iohns follower forsake followe ioseph house confiscate good except gaue ouer armes hearing thing greatly troubled forsooke iohn laid downe weapon came vnto number foure thousand onely fifteene hundreth men remained iohn thereabouts either citizen stranger tyre iohn perceiued circumuented policie euer remained quiet country great feare time sephorites grew bold tooke armes vnder confidence strength wals saw distracted businesse therefore sent cestius gallus gouernour syria praying repaire vnto expedition take possession citie send garrison men least gallus promised come vnto set downe certaine time approch whereof aduertised tooke men warre marched sephorites tooke citie force galilean verie glad opportunitie supposing time come wherein might satisfie insatiable hatred bare citie marched intent would haue wholy ruinated citie inhabitant therefore trauailed streetes set fire house found wholy desolate inhabitant fled away feare retired fortresse therefore sephoris spoiled ransackt thing left nothing vnspoiled neither kinde miserie inflicted countrimen sawe sore griened commanded giue ouer signifying vnto impietie shew themselues sauage towards countrimen seeing neither anie praier commaund made could draw obedience hatred surpassed counsel commanded trusted spred rumour romanes charged v side citie great force ende rumour might pacifie furie galilean saue citie sephoris policie took good effect heard newes affraid forsooke pillage trust heeles especial general like made shew beleeued rumour true belieued stratageme citie sephoris saued beyond hope hardly escaped tiberias spoiled galilean thorow occasion tiberias daunger ruine ensueth chiefest councell wrote vnto king come vnto take possession citie king promised satisfie verie shortly answered letter deliuered one chamber called crispus iewe borne carrie tiberians galilean knowing messenger tooke brought vnto common people vnderstood meere spleene fell armes next daie diuers assembled themselues part came citie asoch made aboad made huge exclamation calling tiberians traitours king friend demaunding licence libertie might repaire tiberias race ground much displeased tiberians sephorites heard stood great doubt might deliuer tiberians displeasure galilean conceiued could denie ioseph consulteth himselfe tiberians written sent king answere made euidently expresse truth hauing long debated matter selfe said vnto know well tiberians haue offended neither hinder spoiling citie yet must proceede execution thereof iudgement tiberians alone doe betray libertie others also accounted countrey galilee stay therfore vntil time thorowly informed author treason shall haue vnder hand amongst may particularly concluded obey king sort rebell iustus desireth commaund galilee roman iustus egged take armes thirsting alteration hoping obtaine gouernment galilee owne countrey hope failed succesfull end galilean intolerable wickednesse therefore fearing least displeasure shorten day went vnto king supposing might liue freely securely sophorites beyond expectation hauing escaped first danger wrote vnto cestius gallus second time requiring come vnto end might sooner seazed citie send force withstand incursion enemy finally wrought much gallus sent store horseman footman came night receiued citie seeing became master better part citie whence notwithstanding afterwards constrained retire knew place killing departure twelue roman footman horseman sephorites onely losse one afterwards fight hapning receiuing commodity silas captaine king guard countrey galilee soone receiued newes hereof sent two thousand souldiers ieremie coronell shrouding themselues within stade iulias neere vnto floud iordan offered nothing el light skirmish vntill time gathered three thousand souldiers come vnto next day hauing planted ambush certaine trench neere vnto enclosure campe touled king soldier skirmish hauing first forewarned souldiers faine flight vntill time drawne enemy far ambush cunningly executed sylas supposing men fled cowardize set forward follow fast might possible lay ambush charged backe discomfited army presently turning making head ioseph putteth king souldiers flight constrained king force trust heeles time estate countrey good point cursed spirit thwarted mine honest purpose horse whereon roade falling certaine bog cast ground whereby mine hand thrust ioint wrist carried burrough cepharnom souldiers hearing hereof fearing least sinister misfortune befallen indeed done restrained themselues pursuing enemie turned backes thorow griefe conceiued reason mine accident hauing therfore sent physitions caused selfe dressed staied day seazed feuer carried night taricheas according aduice physitions sylas souldiers hauing newes mine accident recouered courage vnderstanding kept slender watch campe laid ambush night side iosephs misfortune animateth enemy iordan water taricheas iulias affraid returned backe long vespasian arriued tyre accompanied king agrippa tyrians began vtter many reproches telling vespasian king enemy vespasian agrippa ar •… iue tyre sent herode youngest son gouerne galilee although young nature valiant courage found present occasion shew braue minde tooke ezechias captain theeues vnderstood woont pray vpon confines syria great multitude put death many theeues thing gratefull vnto syrian townes village made song herod though restored peace possession length glorie fact came eares sextus caesar caesar emperours kinsman ruled syria phasaelus also striue ouercome towardnesse phasaelus obtained fauour people ierusalem good reputation brother daily increasing winning himselfe good wils inhabitant ierusalem time gouerned citie nothing insolently might power cause people honoured antipater king reuerenced lord yet fidelitie good neuerthelesse towards hyrcanus impossible man liueth prosperitie enuied hyrcanus although time mooued something glorie young men hyrcanus animated enuious men antipater sonnes especially prosperous successe herod often annoied frequent messenger spred praise euerie thing yet particular stirred vp many enuious person woont haunt court prince grieued antipater sonnes ruled without offence men tolde hyrcanus onely enioyed bare name king antipater sonnes ruled long would permit winke til last would make themselues king much pretend themselues procurator leauing title took vpon dignity lord maisters without regard reuerence toward herod put death great multitude iewes law whereas neither word mouth writing king giuen authoritie herode king herode called answere councell priuate person brought iudgement answere matter shew king reason satisfie lawes countrey permitted man put death law conuicted perswasions hyrcanus grew angrie concealing wrath caused herode sent answere matter father aduertised thereto trusted equity cause first leauing garrison galilee yeare world 3922 christ birth 24 repaired vnto king came accompanied strong guard least either seeme derogate hyrcanus dignitie lead forth many want defence expose himselfe enuie aduersaries sextus caesar also fearing young man least euill betide amongst enemy sent vnto hyrcanus manifestly hyrcanus absolueth herod warning free herode crime murther cause hyrcanus loued herode willing owne accord acquite whereupon supposing escaped king went damascus vnto sextus purposing obey hereafter sent naithelesse hyrcanus againe incited bad people herode certified gone away rage would enterprise hircanus incited wicked something hyrcanus beleeuing knew doe seeing enemie potent himselfe shortly sextus caesar proclaimed generall army syria samaria greatly feared onely highly fauour comminaltie also force commanded hereupon hyrcanus fell extreme feare verily perswading himselfe herod whole army would presently come herode gathering great army commeth ierusalem depose hyrcanus herode disswaded antipater attempting hyrcanus neither suspition vaine herod angrie pretended crime wherof accused came great army ierusalem intending depose hyrcanus effected father brother gone forth meet pacified entreating would account terror wherein put enemy owne indignation sufficient reuenge spare king whose fauour came potent adding moreouer thinke disdaine called answere accusation seeing acquited shewe himselfe gratefull king neither ought reuenge discontent taken shew himselfe vnthankfull saued life moreouer consider fortune warres togither cause thereof thinke warres pretended vniust bidding confident victorie fight owne king alwaies gratious vnto neuer cruell vrged thereunto councell meerely enuious rather satisfie owne mislikes regard disgrace framed shadow accusation herode pacified herewith supposing sufficient obtaine thing hoped haue shewed force vnto nation time began ciuill warre among roman neere vnto apamia caecilius bassus bassus murthereth sextus caesar treason marcus sextus suffered malichus purge himselfe permitted freed suspition celebrated solemne funerall father done went vnto samaria appeased sedition wherewithall citie disquieted returned ierusalem intending place hardly bridle displeasure yet dissembled sent letter vnto cassius wherein complained father death memorie whose hate refreshed offence writ againe vnto herod willing reuenge father death might better effect secretly commanded captaines regiment assist herode surprisall laodicea best citie came herod bringing gift crownes appointed fit time intended reuenge malichus suspecting herod would worke arrowes others issuing troupe foorth citie assaulted forefront army whereupon herode caused one go wals citie proclaime come good vvhole citie would take reuenge though open enemy would pardon euen vvould relieue necessity thus entreated himselfe went field brought much prouision cut siloes excuse forecasting least hereafter yeare world 3925 christ birth 39 want sent letter samaria citie time rendred selfe vnto willing bring victual wine oyle cattell vnto iericho antigonus hearing presently sent certaine men lie ambush field sodainly set vpon came prouision kill hinder carying victual campe obeying commandement went great number souldiers iericho placed themselues vpon mountaines intent espie body carried prouision herod accompanied ten troupe commeth iericho armie meane time herod rested taking ten company fiue romanes fiue iewes amongst mixed three hundred hired besides horsmen came iericho found citie without inhabitant fiue hundreth wiues family placed themselues vpon top mountaines surprised permitted depart romanes brake citie sacked found house stored al maner rich romane got great pray king leauing garrison iericho returned sent likewise romane souldiours city side wit idumaea galilee samaria might abide till winter past antigonus also silo meanes money made friend obtained part armie might winter time abide lydda antonius sake roman discharged warres abounded thing time herod idle accompanied two thousand footman fiue hundreth horse went idumaea sent also brother ioseph least antigonus mean people rebell himselfe hauing carried mother rest kindred tooke massada samaria hauing placed danger might betide himselfe went galilee subdue part country yet hand expell thence garrison left antigonus hee come sephoris notwithstanding snew mightily easily tooke garrison assaulted ant lib 14 cap 24 herod taketh citie sephoris fled finding great store prouision refreshed souldiers winter weather sore tired sent theeues lay lurking dennes caues making often incursion vpon countrey molested inhabitant lesse beene armie enemy sending three company footman one troope horseman village called arbela himselfe fortie dayes came thither whole armie theeues feared arming themselues came herode setteth forth theeues meete trusting experience warlike affaire owne desperate courage ioyning battel right wing battell put left wing herod flight right wing presently succoured recalled men fled rushing violently vpon enemy little asswaged force enemy till last forefront battell able stand longer fled herod pursued euen vnto iordan killed manie escaped fled ouer riuer thus freed galilee feare saue yet hee left lurking caues therfore constrained make longer abode wherfore first gaue souldiours fruit labour distributed euerie one hundreth fiftie drachmes siluer vnto captaines sent passe winter also writ vnto youngest brother pheroras prouide necessary market build wal castle alexandrium performed meane antonius passed time athens ventidius sent silo yeare world 3926 christ birth 38 ant lib ca 25 description caues theeues kept herod assist warre parthian charging comming settle estate iewes herod gladly willingly sent silo vnto ventidius meane time armie went theeues caues caues verie steepe mountaines way come vnto saue onely crooked verie narrow passage moūtains rock stone cleane throughout hanging ouer valleyes king great doubtfull doe seeing place difficult come last herod deuised way scarsly heard put valiantest men coffer let downe edge caues killed theeues family cast fire resisted herod seeking saue caused crier bid come vnto one willingly came vnto forced chose rather die captiues old man hauing seuen sonnes wife requested might go forth king saue liues killed maner himselfe stood doore caue bad come forth one one alwaies one came forth killed yeere world 3926 christ birth 38 herod place might behold spectacle moued compassion stretched forth hand requested spare child nothing moued compassion herodes word vpbraided herodes base mind hauing butchered sonnes also killed wife casting dead body downe vallies finally cast himselfe likewise downe headlong herod hauing thus taken caues slaine leauing part armie much thought might suffice represse attempt rebellion making ptolemaeus chiefe ouer part returned samaria carying three thousand footman sixe hundreth horseman antigonus whose departure ptolemey captaine herod souldiers slaine accustomed trouble galilee molest hauing thought opportunitie assaulted ptolemaeus vnawares killed wasted countrey retiring themselues marish ground secret place herod vnderstood presently came succor countrey killed part enemy hauing taken castle force exacted hundreth talent recompence reuolt paid city parthian put flight pacorus slaine ventidius willed thereto letter antonius sent vnto herod thousand horseman two legion footman assist antigonus antigonus writ letter generall foresaid company named machaera desiring helpe complaining herod iniuried promised summe machaeras iniquitie mony thinking best forsake sent succour especially seeing herod would giue would suborned yet counterfaiting himselfe antigonus friend meaning vnder antipater commaunded neuer talke pheroras wife one belonging herode forbiddeth antipater brother company haue conference wife vnto time obeyed father commaund openly shew secretly lay house fearing salome perceiue friend italy caused make voyage rome letter brought herod wherein commaunded shortly receite thereof antipater sent rome vnto caesar wherefore herode vsing delay sent presently discouereth syllaeus secret caesar herod wherewith fabatus moued yet great estimation herode disclose syllaeus secret signified vnto king syllaeus corrupted corinthus one guard vvilled taken kept hold come insomuch would come brother visite sicke notwithstanding often sent thought lay death bed would gladly impart something vnto contrarie hope recouered afterward pheroras fell sicke time herode man durst speake verie vnwise part vncertaine suspitions depriue himselfe certaine felicitie returne speedily vnto father receiue kingdome hand onely hope counsell fortune would haue antipater followed arriued hauen cesarea passing sebaste contrarie expectation fell great sorrow admiration men eschewed antipater hated caesarea companie man durst come neere although alwayes hated yet libertie shew hatred manie abstained comming feare king rumour thing antipater done knowne euerie citie euerie man antipater himselfe ignorant thereof neuer man brought thither maiestie hee saile rome neuer man basely entertained returne vnderstanding massacre home craftily made himselfe ignorant thereof notwithstanding almost dead feare yet countenance counterfeited confidence hee could possibly make anie escape rid himselfe present daungers yet heard certaine newes matter home king edict forbidden men giue notice thereof manie time comforted himselfe thus either matter concerning yet secret thing come light policie impudencie could acquite himselfe thereof two refuge hope thus determined went king pallace alone without anie friendes follower verie first gate contumeliously repulsed chaunce varus ruler syria within boldly going father came neere vnto though hee would haue saluted herode stretching forth hand shaking head cried thou hast attempted murther thy father darest thou yet presume offer embrace antipaters entertainment father hand art guiltie manie treachery god confound thee wicked wretch come neere till thou hast cleared thy selfe laid thee thou shalt haue iustice varus shall thy iudge good fortune go premeditate acquite thee morrow giue thy subtill craftie braine time hereat antipater astonished feare able reply anie thing went way presently mother wife came vnto told proofes treason calling wit together thought himselfe answere euerie point next day king caused assemblie friend kinsfolk admitted antipaters friend varus sitting iudgement commanded proofes withstood souldiers iericho would haue crowned promised confirmed king authoritie would largely recompence souldiers people archelaus promiseth subiects fauour good fully purposed better vnto father multitude hereat greatly reioyced made present triall mind purpose cried requesting tribute might exacted others desired yearly paiments might cease others requested giue prisoner libertie archelaus fauour people graunted request offering sacrifice banquetted friend sodainly noone time day great multitude desirous alteration common lamentation king death ceased began priuate mourning bewailing asedition pulling downe eagle agent thereof ant lib 17 cap 12 archelaus bountie towards seditious mischance herod put death pulling golden eagle porch temple sorrow secret whole citie resound lament thought haue lost liues temple countrie lawes also cried reuenge taken vpon herod fact rewarded money first herod constituted high priest bee reiected another holy deuout put place archelaus although hereby moued reuenge yet presently take iourny abstained frō fearing least brought multitude hatred might hinder wherfore sought rather admonishing force reclaime seditious sent gouernour souldiers request bee pacified authours sedition soone came temple spake one word threw stone like manner vsed others sent appease archelaus dispatched many messenger vnto thē spitefully intreated making shew beene number would haue beene appeased therefore feast vnleauened bread drew nigh iewes call easter wherein infinite number sacrifice appointed innumerable feast easter solemnly kept much sacrifice offered multitude people came village thereabout deuotion sake solemnitie lamented death sophisters remained temple seeking meanes nourish sedition archelaus fearing sent band souldiers tribune take chiefe seditious time drawne vnto multitude people whole number stirred vp slewe great many stone tribune himselfe sore hurt much ado escape done presently went offered sacrifice though hurt beene done archelaus perswaded himselfe multitude would appeased without slaughter wherefore sent vnto whole armie footman citie horsmen field inuading seditious people sacrificing three thousand iewes slaine feast easter slew almost three thousand scattered residue mountaines neere adioyning also crier followed archelaus proclaimed vertue commaund euerie one depart home house euerie one notwithstandinding holinesse day departed accompanied mother popla ptolemaeus nicholaus friend went vnto sea coast leauing philip gouernour kingdome ouer houshold departed salome child king brother kinred vnder pretence assist archelaus crowne indeed informe caesar done temple law came caesarea met sabinus gouernour syria comming toward iudaea take custodie herod treasure varus forbad go anie sabinus commeth iudaea sease ye fortress keepe treasure ant lib 17 cap 13 antipas elected king herodes former testament striueth archelaus kingdome sent archelaus ptolemie requesting thereunto sabinus loue varus neither entred castle shut vp herod treasure archelaus promised would let alone till caesar vnderstood thereof soone one hindered gone antiochia wit archelaus rome still remaining casarea hasted vnto ierusalem tooke king pallace calling chiefe guard purueyors exacted account sought take custodie castle strong hold captaines garrison mindfull charge archelaus gaue kept vnto themselues custodie affirming kept caesar archelaus time antipas made claime crowne alleaging herod first testament force last yeare world 3964 christ birth 2 first declared king salome many kinred sayled archelaus promised aid tooke mother ptolemaeus brother vnto nicholaus perswading himselfe trustinesse loyaltie vnto herod would stand great steed ptolemaeus herod dearest friend also great confidence irenaeus antipas accuseth archelaus letter caesar orator excellent grace pleading much refused counsell sought perswade yeeld vnto archelaus age last testament father well beloued kin •… ed rome hated galilee sword fire horseman sixe thousand foote placidus tribune gouernour horsmen deuided themselues two company lodged great plaine footman garrison citie defend horseman staied without horseman made excursion euerie side greatly molested ioseph quietly bent also spoiled without city alwaies repulsed inhabitant time tooke courage reuenge themselues notwithstanding ioseph assaulted citie sephoris hoping take time reuolted vnto roman compassed strong wals roman themselues could haue taken hope frustrate neither force faire meanes would sephorites yeeld vnto hereat roman angry troubled country neither night day ceased frō destroying robbed spoiled found men able beare armes slew made rest slaues thus galilee filled fire sword man escaped calamitie onely saued themselues fled city ioseph walled titus came alexandria winter sooner expected receiued souldiers sent hauing prosperous iourney quickly came ptolemais titus bringeth mightie army iudaea finding father two chiefest legion wit fifth tenth also adioyned fifteenth legion brought followed eighteene company fiue caesarea one troupe horseman fiue company horseman syria tenne company foote euery one thousand men rest may admire roman traine vp seruants time peace verie fit warres whosoeuer well beholdeth militarie discipline shal perceiue gained goodly empire chance fortune yeare world 4031 christ birth 69 diligence labour roman prouiding thing necessary war vertue onely begin vse weapon come fight practise militarie discipline need idle time peace alwaies practise themselues therein without ceasing exercise like warre selfe euery souldier euerie day exercised euery sort weapon euen though fighting enemie hereby easily indure burthen trauaile warres disorder doth make forget neither doth feare dismay continuance fight warre wearie tire whosoeuer fight well prouided affaire alwaies ouercome one may well call practises amongst themselues conflict without bloudshed war indeed conflict bloudshed easily ouercome vnawares enemiecountrey soeuer come fight haue fortified campe industry roman order roman campe rashly neither pitch tent marish high place disordered maner place vnequall make plaine proportion campe foure square haue many smith kind workemen needfull still follow armie accomplish busines innermost part campe make tabemacles whose outside resembleth wall tower equally distant one another betweene engine warre cast stone like kind shot may readines also build foure gate large wide cattell easily come also themselues need require enter issue speedily within campe souldiers captain commaunded morning souldiers come vnto captaines salute captaines tribune generall giueth watch word telleth thinketh good shall behaue themselues towards vnder whereby fight may demeane themselues well know assault retire go forth campe trumpet soundeth man idle first becke taketh away tabernacle make readie departure trumpet soundeth warning readie hauing laden beast baggage roman forsake campe expect sound againe though run race departure burne campe easie build like againe also least afterwards may aduantage enemy trumpet hath sounded third time signe set forward hasten concerning warlike discipline roman attempt nothing vnaduisedly rashly neuer thing vnaduisedly battaile manage thing according counsell either erre doe fault easily amended thinke bad successe deliberation better good fortune without thinke therein fortune flatter worke great despight reason haue deliberated premeditated although haue euill successe yet maketh warie another time none accounteth good successe cōmeth chance yeare world 4031 christ birth 69 yet euerie one comforted misfortune take good aduise militarie exercise make body soldier strong mind also hardie diligence haue liued pleasantly whome sent become traytor vnto ioseph afraid roman writeth ierusalem countrie committed charge wherefore hee determined faithfully write estate estate countrie vnto nobilitie ierusalem extoll enemy force much least say hee coward yet putting comfort least perhaps penitent done againe letter incited goe forward rebellious course willing presently write answere whether thought good enter league roman would make warre send sufficient armie roman hauing written effect presently sent men away ierusalem beare letter chap vii siege iotapata vespasian verie desirous take got betweene flesh armour scorched like fire easily heated long continuing hot reason fatnesse roman loaden helmet briest plate could flie lept downe bridge others griefe died others would faine haue naturally beautified yet agrippa cost charge much adorned iordan beginneth deepe riuer denne passeth along marish place durtie lake semechonitis thence description genezar fertilitie genezar hundreth twentie furlong vnto citie iulia way deuideth lake genezar passing great way wildernes last endeth lake called asphaltites vpon lake genezar bordereth countrey name naturally beautifull admirable kind dominion countrie likewise giuen al nation vnderstand neither multitude enemy strong hold greatnesse city rashnesse barbarous crueltie aduersaries could euer resist force romanes escape hand souldiers due desert behaued thēselues valiantly hasarded themselues effected worthy deed whosoeuer forward thē rest haue reward according desert would diligent honouring thē bin companion warre punishing offence presently hee willed appertained yeare world 4034 christ birth •… 72 titus large souldiers nominate valiantly behaued themselues warres performed anie worthie exployt done hee called euerie one name praised greatly reioycing valour countrimen crowning crownes gold put chaines gold neckes gaue large speares gold ensignes made siluer also preferred euery one gaue spoyle precious garment gold siluer verie plentiously thus hauing rewarded euerie one according merite praising god armie hee descended great applause tribunall went offered sacrifice victorie •… nd hauing gathered appointed purification chamber bed carnall copulation many thing long rehearse purification vsed sacrifice speech opinion god himselfe law concerning marriage law onely alloweth naturall copulation betweene man wife done intent get child men abuse one another nature altogether disalloweth punisheth offender death commandeth v marrie respecting marriage dowrie neither must take woman violently force allure deceitfull perswasions wee rather obtaine goodwill may graunt vse ordinarie meanes perswade also appointeth woman shall thing inferiour man neither obey committing wickednes one vnder gouernment god gaue punishment doth rauish virgine man authoritie husband may lawfully accompanie abhomination make triall another man attempteth wise auoide death like penaltie attendeth hee offer violence virgine despowsed vnto man perswasions doe ouercome married woman hath child vnder law commaundeth hath also interdicted woman concealing child borne otherwise destroy shee child killer destroy soules mankind therefore vseth carnall copulation corruption vncleane lawes woman lawfull copulation must wash themselues iudging part soule act defiled shee puffed vp wounded bodie therefore purification bodie law ordained water purification neither lawfull feast banquet childbirth wherby occasion drunkennesse may grow beginning temperate likewise commaunded traine vp child learning may learne law action forefather imitate trained vp law may sinne transgresse ignorance law hath also prouided buriall dead funeral neither bee pompeous sepulchre gorgious commaunding euerie houshold performe necessary funeral dead touching buriall dead permitting men one death assemble themselues together bewaile dead also commaundeth euerie one yea euen dead man owne family purifie themselues buriall goe farreoff seeming bee vncleane also appointeth punishment haue committed murder either wilfully bindeth euerie man obey parent next god commaundeth child doe shewe themselues gratefull vnto thing doe honour due parent grieue stoned death also commandeth yong men reuerence olde men god elder v permitteth friend councell impietie god friend doth disclose friend fall doe know one anothers secret yet commaunded bewray iudge take bribe punished death omitting iustice assisting guiltie man must take thing vsurie away himselfe placed man must take owne man lending must take vsurie many like thing law commaundeth concerning cause communion betweene v others also amisse recount law maker prouided entertaining stranger amongst v seemeth haue prouided knowledge wee neither corrupt owne lawes denie impart others hee entertaineth liberally come liue vnder lawes iudging communitie man life much consist nation whereof come vnitie mind conuersation forbiddeth others stranger come intent admitted solemnity yet commanded v exhibite vnto thing necessarie wee giue vnto men fire water meate burie dead hath also mildly determined ought ought vse enemy deale enemy wee neither destroy countrie fire downe fruit tree wee also forbidden rob spoyle slaine fight deale iniuriously captiues especially woman yea hee endeuoured teach v humanitie mildnes prouided vse euen vnreasonable beast courteously imploy serue lawfull need forbiddeth v kill tame thing bred house kill olde beast young together although many wilde beast enemy mankind doe assist v labour yet commaunded spare also euerie point hee established humanitie mildnesse amongst v vsing said lawes direct v therein enacting also infringe foresaid law may al seueritie punished punishment allotted violaters hereof repetition precept law part death man commit adulterie rauish virgine vse sinne nature another suffer himselfe bee abused also haue lawes concerning seruants measure weight vnlawfull bargaines sale deceite either one take thing man owne punished nation punish much grieuously whosoeuer either iniurieth parent committeth impietie god shall presently bee destroyed obserue law rewarded gold siluer crowne beset precious stone euerie one hauing conscience witnesse doth greatly profit gaine eternitie lawmaker prophecieth god himselfe doth assuredly promise obserue chance bee forced suffer death yet doe ioyfully goe execution nothing doubting shall exchange life better bee loth report reward keepe law deedes make manifest many forefather onely refused speake lawes otherwise lawes permitted haue manfully constantly indured torment death selfe nation vnknowne world voluntarie obseruation lawes manifest people man report vnto greekes either hee read haue declared else hee continuance lawes amongst iewes found people straunge land bee hauing pius honest opinion concerning god many age perseuered therein doubt would admire wonder hereat considering great mutabilitie amongst themselues bee short sticke deride haue lately written gouernement commonwealthes lawes though written thinges fabulous altogether impossible speake nothing philosopher haue written argument diuine plato amongst greekes man honest life vertuous speech plato admired amongst greekes sound philosophie excelled others man almost continually scoffed owne conceit skilfull ciuill affaire brought vice comedy whereas whosoeuer considereth writing diligence shall often easily finde matter agreeable men manner yea plato himselfe confesseth dare reason common people ignorance set downe true opinion god many thinke
