priest well instructed eleazar brought vnto antiochus 〈◊〉 macch 6 antiochus exhortation eleazar learning feare god man aged yeeres verie reuerent countenaunce one knowne men famous vertue man antiochus said thus aduised holy olde man eschew torment prepared obstinate preserue thy reuerent age contemne benefit life take sacrifice eate swine flesh contrarie wise men aduice credit iewes opinion refuse meate nature hath well ordained mankind wee shew selues vngratefull god benefit contemne grace make difference nature hath made none reason shew beast abhominable others either beast eaten else eschewed superstition idlenesse barre selues thing law haue set apart vaine sottish opinion least venerable age chaunge thy opinion better suppose lawes forcible obserued yet excuse thee seeing thou dost sinne voluntarily compulsion eleazar permitted speake thus replied antiochus exhorted forced breach lawes wee antiochus follow vaine report obserue eleazars answere antiochus veritie religion father kept feare torment cannot make v embrace religion forsake owne yea suppose religion deliuered v forefather firme ground yet would nothing compelled torment forsake esteeme small matter eate impious meat taste sacrificed idol prophane thing touch thing prophane law condemneth philosophie wherein ignorant thinketh himselfe wise taught embrace sobrietie subdue v inordinate appetite keepe body chast suffer patience whatsoeuer god sake inflicted vpon v denie truth iustice pietie god alone true thefore refuse prophane meat well knowing ought eate warranted therein precept almightie god whose lawes haue learned obey eschew meat sacrificed vnto idol embrace force expedient soule open tyranny compell one religion forbiddeth commaunde contrarie iustice doe thou wilt mocke thy pleasure yet shalt thou derided thou thy selfe deridest persist holy step forefather notwithstanding thou therefore tyrannous hand plucke mine eies sharpe knife rip vp entrailes thou shalt neuer conquer die safe sound patient loue god neither flatter thy selfe aged bodie feeble need must sacrificed god sake thou shald finde yeeres lustie child constant young man yea ioyful torment prepare extraordinarie fire else soeuer thou shalt find constant midst torment came sacred religion neuer violate thee eleazar constancie foundation saluation defence beleeuer ground faith neuer lift vp hand contrarie thy precept neuer beleeue thing iust repugnant thou hast taught wil loose merit many yeers relinquish faith haue hitherto embraced chast pure deuout company father shall receiue number shall feare impious king thy threat thou hast changed name king tyrāt yet thou shalt neuer alleage deed consent word whilst eleazar full constancie libertie spake thus souldiers stood hailed tortured stripping naked hanged vp whipped eleazar cruelly whipped whilst either side beaten crier impious voice still cried vnto obey king pleasure commaund worthie eleazar ouercome torment suffered torture though beene rest sleepe manfully without feare endure torment fixing venerable eies vpon heauen knew beleeued sacrificed soule beholding flesh side rent torne bodie bloud issuing great aboundance admired owne patience thanked god author thereof last feeling himselfe frailtie flesh scarcely able endure sharpe torment fell vpon face stripe rent torne still glorifying god fall one souldiers gratifie king like mad man spurne tread vpon thereby increase torment eleazar strong bodie mind like right champion true god neuer shrinke paine patient olde man patience ouercome crueltie tormentor euen torturer thēselnes admired endured many torment king officer comming vnto said long eleazar wilt thou neglect obey king free thy selfe torment eate flesh swine redeeme thy selfe thou endurest eleazar although martyrdome beene silent yet could without answering endure heare prophane counsaile tormented speach cried sonnes hebrewes effeminate forsake way saluation wherein haue walked euen vntil olde age neither taught auoiding contumelie long continue giue others example occasion sinne life continue forsake smal trifle yet hope great moment wilt thou tyrant esteeme v yeeld vnto thee nay thou mightest iustly reprooue inconstancie therefore die resigne soules venerable father abraham thy bosome souldiers seeing constancie king commaund cast fire powred stincking loathsome liquor nostril reuerent olde man eleazars last word fire willingly suffer consumed flame yet nature began faile hee spake manner lifting vp daseled eies heauen thou art god life saluation proceedeth behold die obseruing thy lawes mercifull vnto thy nation forsake thou hast hitherto protected euen thy bosome vnder shadow wing thy clemencie let death ende miserie pacifie thy wrath bent whole nation offence receiue bestow vpon amidst speech ioyfully yeelded vp ghost true therefore first affirmed wit enduring paine torment wrought reason lore determined resolued maketh prosperous suffering paine patience wisely aduising men best doth settle confirme opinion reason victorie follow therefore reason inferiour power variance must subiect reason make perfect victorie guide reason father eleazar safely directed neither ouercome paine giue place vnto vnlawfull enticement allurement saued ship bodie shipwracke might arise tempestuous stormes vanitie suffered himselfe contrarie winde driuen right course yea though tossed vpon waues tyrannie yet remaine sound vnbroken keeping direct course arriued hauen saluation neuer man seeke valiantly defend citie enemie holy olde man soule amongst stripe cross flame still man toppe high rocke standeth sase resisteth waue without domage vnto selfe euen rocke reason man beat backe rage tempestuous waues beat bodie permitting breake pierce celestiall diuine power soule happie olde man blessed thy age similitude taken rocke priest sacred priest didst pollute thy sacred lip prophane meat impietie found entrance way whence many praiers god proceeded tyrant cruelty could preuaile thee thou therfore art made example eleazars praise priest god imitate one behooued priest strong torment able suffer torturer inflict punishment forcible prince command yea potent fire wherein thou didst perish finally thou wast ordained crowned lawrell martyrdome thy sufferance thou hast surpassed antiquitie thou shalt example posterity feeble olde age wherein al strength heat bodie extinguished vnfit suffer torment alreadie broken age could aduice reason endure many torment many misery dare denie reason chiefe cause sufferance haue seene cruelty hath beene ouercome determination persist seruice feare god yet many affirme men vse aduice reason able vndergoe agony assertion vaine force euident onely ouercome paine wisedome hath armed patience maruaile rashly enterprise waightie matter due consideration last forsake repent himselfe vnaduisedly vndertooke due aduice deliberation arme ourselues easie matter remoue v misfortune determination make account misfortune betide v easily dismaied thereat doth beride nothing befell v expected therefore wise valiant able conquer passion doth well deli berate commeth agony put determination execution neither wisedome olde man much admired seeing child infant haue deserued commendation point worke astonishment tormentor courage crueltie antiochus ouercome wisedome old age antiochus caused seuē noble young men hebrew mother bee brought antioch 2 macch 7 increased wicked counsell caused seuen worthie child hebrew brought vnto antioch castle sosandrum young yeeres hee thought weake vnable suffer torment hope either perswasions terror torture might force renounce religion therefore commaunded seuen together mother salomona grew well yeeres bee brought according commaund brought excellent beautie worthie child vertuous mother yea resembled angel face shining like cleare light sunne eye sparkled comely decent maner testifying surpassed vertue al humane race condition shee descended vertuous noble parentage shee selfe continued liued excellent feature body enriched nobilitie bloud dignitie also made noble vertue fortitude wherein shee passed thing could bee said commendation tyrant beholding mother amongst merrie gladsome countenance hee thus craftily spake vnto child wish good admirable youngmen king exhortation seuen brother beautie body noble parentage perswade doe therefore like mad men resist commaund auoide onely torment death also desire onely exalt vnto honour also increase rich possession contemne superstitious superfluous beliefe countrimen imbrace religion refuse doe hope deuise torment whereby may lingering paineful death consume end terrifie commaunded instrument torment bee presented vnto view eyesight wheeles roddes hooke rake rackes caudrons cag •… gridiron brought forth engine torment finger hand gauntlet awles bellowes brazen pot frying pan name find terme bellowes thinne plate yron kindle blow fire like fanne farre horrible deuises torment shewed vnto long rehearse whereof hauing sight antiochus said consent vnto prudent young men commaund commit sinne yet doe offend seeing commit onely vpon compulsion young young men constancie youthes inflamed diuine spirit sense contemned many kind torment despised tyrant threates flattery godly gaue iust occasion driue tyrant greater rage euident reason maister ouer passion slouthful man trained vp sodaine come push verie sight torment mind would haue beene troubled countenance appalled leg vnder would haue trembled feare cōfounded wold haue presētly stept back frō agonie would forthwith haue alleadged himselfe vnable beare many grieuous torment saying selfe vnwise haue made choyce whether endure torment accept promised benefit whether haue beene moued pittie mine owne age compassionate mother god would haue denied pardon deede forced thereunto though shall get king fauour reason aduise taketh place hath well trained mind perfection consequently followeth example seuen brother reply vnto antiochus brother declare one voice denied eate sacrificed swine flesh commaunded wherefore said tyrant dost thou persecute v innocent desire wish die vntill time death expelleth life firmely keepe god commaunded moyses taught v thou tyrant seeke seduce v protesting feined loue towards v thou louer iniustice master crueltie deuiser iniquitie pardon thou doest offer v painefull punishment armed contempt death esteeme thy word late master eleazar taught despise thē dost thou esteeme pusillanimitie v young mē seeing late thou foundest courage old man follow thou canst trie know mind except tearing body thou search wee safely securely suffer god thing leauing earth shall entertained heauen thou tyrannizing cruelly vpon innocent soules shalt bee reserued eternall fire tyrant greatly mooued see hee could neither preuaile faire promise threatnings caused beaten buls peasels first commanded macchabeus eldest seuen brother stripped stretched vpon racke hand bee bound behind bee cruelly beaten wearied tormentor antiochus cō manded macchabeus bee racked suffering great force vertue desired leaue beating requested leaue done put vpon wheele weight hanged feete stretched round sinewes entrailes brake paine increased yet ouercome paine mouth stopped hindred calling vpon god beheld reprouing tyrant deuised torment innocent taking strength said haue cried manner bloudie tyrant persecutest maiestie god whome thou thus tormentest witch one haue murdered killed another man one dye iustice obseruing law charitie whē torturer ouercome compassion willed submit himselfe vnto king pleasure answered ye wicked minister tyrannie wheeles sharpe cruell thereby forced forsake heauen whereon mind fixed teare flesh yea please rost fire torture torment parcell bodie seuerall crueltie shall finde selues vnable force v young men impietie thus spake fire kindled hee hee vppon wheele racked throwne fire thus hee flame torment burned bowel appeared mind nothing moued flesh yeelded ouercome paine amidst death elder brother pang cried thus vnto brother beloued brother learne example vertue consider strength inuincible courage contemne despise alluring baites world rather obey god tyrant hee please humble proud mightie exalt lowly deiected thus spake hee taken flame fleane aliue tongue pulled mouth put frying pan hee departed life great admiration beheld ioy brother mother went heauen prepare kingdome himselfe second brother bought second brother called aber hailed souldiers tyrant asked whether would relent hee caused torm ents shewed thereby terrifie hee nothing thereat moued denying eate foresaid sacrifice hand bound yron chaines hee hanged vp skinne bodie fleane crowne head vnto knee entrailes brest appeared naked yet manner yet might abide greater torment hee cast cruell libarde thirsting extremely bloud intent hee might deuour teeth rest bodie beast smelling doubt great handie worke almightie god forgot crueltie turning away face hee hurt martyr hereat tyrant rage increased martyr suffering torment made constant cry alowde pleasant death vnto caused sort torment god sake yea much pleasant assuredly hope finde reward heauen let torment inflicted vpon tyrant satisfie thy crueltie paine thy torture increased rather pleasure thou shalt finde patience agonie willing suffer thou punish yea paine suffering lesse thine inflicting vpon tormented vertue obseruing law iustice god shall banish thee thy regall seate thou tormenting art tormēted almost consumed thy wrath furie almost spent vpon vaine thou shalt escape day iudgement eternall paine prepared thee neither thy prophane minde able endure thy crueltie power decline thy sinful soule condemned eternall punishmentsthus hee remaining constantly faith animated brother example departed vnto heauen michir third sonne brought men pittied death two machir third brother brought brother many exhorted brother example desist opinion auoid punishment hereat angrie thus replied one father begot v one mother bore v one master instructed v one mind alike affected doe therefore longer prolōg time vaine came hither suffer speake vse tyrannie possible bodie haue power ouer soulethe tyrant hereat moued see third nothing relent brother death deuised crueltie thē humane wit alone could inuēt wherefore commaunded globe brought tied holy martyr sort bone set ioynt displaced whereat holy martyr nothing dismaid skin also head face pulled put vpon wheele could racked worse bone displaced hang one separated pitifull manner bloud issuing aboundantly depriued vse hand feete perceiuing life spent spake thus died tyrant endure torment loue god thou author iniust crueltie shalt suffer euerlasting paine tongue cut mouth put frying panne amidst torment yeelded vp ghost next followed iudas fourth brother people perswaded entreated obey king contemning praiers exhortation said thus constancie iudas fourth brother brought fire shall neither separate seuer law god brother steed mortall life enioy life euerlasting denounce vnto thee tyrant destruction ouerthrow beleeue saluation make triall therefore thou cruell wretch see god forsake hath open stretched armes receiued three brother gone wombe holy mother seuerall time brought forth vnto glorie cruell tyrant hearing much moued lept downe chaire torment martyr himselfe might ouercome furie commaunded tongue cut forth hereat terrified said vnto antiochus crueltie nothing auaile thee neither shalt thou hereby tyrannt thou supposest conquer god need voice awakened rather secret cogitation praied vnto helpe seruants prouideth hold peace heareth praiers doe call vpon deserue heard onely requireth puritie soule god knoweth thing aske selues enter cogitation thereof vnderstādeth necessitie cut toong thou canst cut mind life remaineth praiers haue vttered almightie god haue taught suffer would god thou wouldest sanctifie part body punishing thou therein inflictest punishment vpon thy selfe reward vpon thinke thou shalt thus escape long vnpunished thus spoken tongue cut mouth bound stake beaten rope end patiently endure notwithstanding colour face became dead wanne loosed thence put vpon wheele praying countriemen death went vnto rest brother achas fifth brother haled torment spake manner behold death fourth brother achas fifth condemned thee hell fire make vp number fiue thy paine may encreased tell bloudie wretch offence v committed dost thou thus punish v impietie dost thou persecute v villany haue committed wickednesse naughtinesse haue attempted thou canst alleage v honour god creator liue iustly obedience lawes therefore esteeme thy punishment v honour saluation punishment shall greatly rewarded god part v left alreadie deuised alreadie ouercome master crueltie enemie pietie persecutor iustice sixe worthie young men haue conquered king power kingdome whole world could offorde thy fire cold heateth king hoping winne faire speech thy brethren calamitie thou well hast learned prepared thee thou disobey deliuer thy selfe therfore torment giue thee honour kingdome affoord thou shalt magistrate generall armie one councellors perceiuing himselfe preuaile caused young man mother called vnto comming standing neere sonne tyrant said thus vnto worthie woman thy child behold number thou please destinie affoords thee one aduise therefore thy child mollifie obstinate minde wholesome corunsell mother hauing heard king said enclined selfe vnto king done king might vnderstand spake hebrew child followeth tongue requested vnbound secret disclose vnto king vnlettered presently ranne torment prepared frying pan red hot prepared suffer vnto child comming remembring brother beholding also king said vnto cruell tyrant know thee onely haue beene cruell brother euen crueltie itselfe wretch thou art gaue thee purple exalted thee kingdom dignitie euen thou v dost persecute whose seruants worshipper thou killest tormentest thy wickednes thy selfe shall suffer eternal fire torment shall haue end thou art higher dignitie authority world men yet made men made thee also nature al men borne must die alike killeth another sheweth himselfe may bee killed thou tearest tormentest thy owne picture image vaine thou thy furie killest long since god created like thy selfe according law thou thinkest lawfull thy kingly power commaund thou pullest tongue tearest body fleshhookes consumest v men borne must die alike fire haue alreadie suffered haue receiued euerlasting ioy reward thou shalt anuswere
